And you would think, "They can't possibly get this order wrong, right?" WRONG! SO WRONG!  I should have know my order was going to be wrong when I approached the service window and the guy working the window asked if I order two Sweet Teas (he had drinks in hand) and I said, "that's not my order." When I finally received my order, I checked my order before driving off, and it looked correct. MISTAKE: I didn't check the pie because it was in a "pumpkin pie" box so you automatically think the pie MUST be in there right? WRONG AGAIN. SO WRONG!   When I got home a few minutes later and finished my McChickens...I was excited to try the new Pumpkin Pie, which came in a brown/orangish box, but it wasn't a pumpkin pie. Nope...it was an Apple Pie. WTH? I told you it was WRONG...SO SO WRONG.  How do you get a simple order like that mixed up? I can't even imagine ordering like $15 worth of food at this location. Do you know how messed up that order would be? The only word that comes to mind is...WRONG! SO WRONG!  Try another McDonald's location and skip this place. It's not even worth the trouble...even at 2:30am ordering off the dollar menu.

Came at 5:30pm middle of the week. There were about 5 cars in front of me so it took about 5 mins to place my order but once I did I was gone with my food within a minute. Super nice/ funny employees. Was really surprised at the service for it being in the middle of K street. And unlike every other review my order was COMPLETELY CORRECT- 2mchickens, 1 cheeseburger no pickles.

How is it lately every time I come here for a hot mocha late night there's always a reason the machine just happens to be getting cleaned and takes two hours to clean . When before it only took 15 minutes if i ask to wait they begrudgingly seem to clean it in less then 20 minutes now this time they tell me it's auto cleaning and it's going to take two hours really ? Very dissapointed considering the other late night McDonald's I go to serves mocha no mater what the time

Writing a review about fast food restaurants is not something I often do mainly because of the fact that each experience varies due to a high staff/management turnover. Rarely will you see the same employee twice over a number of month or years so it's a tossup if the service is going to be good especially for chain locations.   Today I left the K street McDonalds feeling as if some wrongs were righted in the world after going to the Broadway McDonalds and discovering that they provided me with a bowl of a few oats coupled with a copious amount of hot water. I am not a fan of returning food because I do not want anything extra in my meal but I decided to go to a different location to air my grievances.   Pros: Gloria, the morning manager, gave me no quarrels with replacing the oatmeal although we know each McDonalds is for the most part separately owned. She quickly offered a smile and a new bowl without going through a whole speech of how she could not help me.  I will definitely be returning to this location and Broadway and 24th can suck it.
Stopped here to get my daughter something fast , before going to doctor appointment ., busy , no where to park., I was there MAY 1, 2012

Quick service and great location with friendly employees!! I love their $1 menu especially their ice cream cones. The sausage mcMuffin for a buck is the best thing for breakfast when you're in a hurry.

O buh Gawd. I lub BicDownals! It's sooo gud. Mmmb. 20 piece Chickend BicDuggits?!? Such a gud deal. Could feed a whole fambly ond them. Bud I down't do that. :D I just eat them awlll by byself. Mmmb. I bix honey bustered and regular hondey, o boy! And I dip umb - I just dip umb. One by oned. It's like I'm Romban Empberer, bud instead of pealed grapes...BICDUGGITS! :D One by one, into by belly.      I biss their BicDLTs frumb the 80s though. O! And I still have sumb Disney Dumbo, Alladin & Buulan  glasses in my cubboard from BicDownals. They are faded frumb the dishwasher, but sooo cool.  Rawdald BicDownal is by hombboy. His red afro his so fundy. O! AND THE BILK SHAKES? Tribble thick. So gud.   Their juggle gym is fun. I like the bawl pit. The Hamblerger should get the death pendalty though. Crimbinals are crimbinals and they'll never learn unless you kill themb. Two lead BigDuggits - right to the head. That's what I say. Haha. Just kidding. I just don't like his height requirebents on the juggle gym. :D That's all.   The Hamblerger cool in my book except for that I'm over 4'9 and I wanna bounce in the bawl pit, but can't now that i'm older. I got my eye on you Hamblerger! ;D

I like how the staff greets you when you enter the restaurant, if things are busy of course. The staff that I've encountered have been very friendly and they never mess up on my order. The parking here can be a bit difficult at times but it's usually ok.

Everyone knows about McDonald's.   It doesn't really need to be reviewed.  The two star rating that I'm giving this specific McDonald's isn't relative to other restaurants, but to other McDonald's.  This location is super convenient to my house and unfortunately, is also convenient to downtown bums and people that need to be in mental hospitals.  Visit at your own risk.

Open 24 hours...  I ordered nuggets and tried the buffalo sauce for the first time. Very similar to hooters and franks red hot sauce. I officially like that and the sweet n sour.  We came in at 1am and nuggets and fries were not up to par - soggy.  If you drive a large car, the drive thru might be hard to maneuver in and out of.

The other day I got the Deluxe Quarter Pounder with cheese. The bun was soaking wet with ketchup mustard and mayo. I couldnt even pick it up without the burger falling out. It was a soggy disgusting mess. Last night I ordered two sausage burritos thru the drive thru. I only live about two minutes away. When I got home, the burritos were stone cold, the cheese co-agulated. The next time I come here, I will insist on.getting a freshly made item and will wait for it.

I dont like leaving negative yelp reviews, for the most part,because they seem unfair. However, this McDonalds is terrible. It is close to my house, but I will almost always drive the 15 minutes extra to.go somewhere else, they NEVER complete an order correctly. Today I was tired and took a.chance. All I wanted was an egg and cheese biscuit, 2 pieces of.sausage and a strawberry creme pie. First, they cashier couldnt find the button, I guess. I repeated the simple order more than 10 times. I tried to remain patient but it is difficult at times like this.  Despite the slowly, and several times, repeated order, the cashier could not complete the order. He approachs another worker who sends him away, then.he waits for a second worker to.acknowledge him.  Finally, she agrees to help him. I repeat the order again.  She enters in part of my.order and abandons the cashier.  I ask him to repeat the order I placed. It sounds correct. Then I recieve my receipt and of course,.its incorrect.  Again, I struggle to get 2 pieces of sausage. Finally, i get my.food and of.course its.wrong, but at this point im so frustrated, I just leave. On top of everything no one.was pleasant, no one apologized for their haplessness, no one even offered a friendly smile. Its just frustrating and this McDonalds Is ALWAYS like that. Ill never take a gamble on them again. I know McDonalds has affordable prices but does that mean, I shouldnt expect the minimum of customer service? Or that I should hope the order is correct?
I enjoyed my big mac and appreciated the recycling bins.

Consistently the slowest 'fast food' burger drive through but I decided to write the review today because the white manager looking girl got smart with me because she couldn't explain why I was overcharged.  instead she got frustrated and asked me if I wanted to change my order instead of trying to figure out why it was overcharged.   20pc chicken nugget meal = $9.99  they said to go big is .79 more  I look at my receipt and I paid $12.70 something.   Tax = $1.01  Ok, so no tax would have been $11.70 - $9.99 meal = price to go big  Price to go big = $1.71 ..... not .79 cents  So I explain to her and she takes huge deep frustrated breaths (not trying to hide her frustration at all) and cuts me off saying "Sir do you want me to change your order?"   No , I want to pay the correct amount for what I ordered. The way she said it was like someone scolding. She made me feel like shit and I just walked right out of there. I hope everyone can read this review and I hope to somehow send this off to Mc. Donald's corporate if they even have a email address for that.

What does a girl have to do to get sweet and sour sauce around here? Apparently, a lot.   Let me back up. We were told to drive around and wait in the parking lot for a grilled chicken sandwich that we ordered. So we waited for a grilled chicken sandwich for 10 minutes. Yes, 10 minutes!!! Hello, where's the fast in that food? All I ask is for a fair trade.   So I went inside finally to find out what happened to our food. When I asked for a couple of more sweet and sour sauces (just two -- and I ordered chicken nuggets) they said no. NO.   I explained that we waited for a sandwich for 10 minutes ... they said they gave us 2 apple pies and could not give us more sauce. Weak sauce!!! (quote by David O.)  Our cabbie told us that we should have gone to Del Taco but we didn't listen. Doug you are so wise. Next time, we shall listen.  Isn't supposed to be my way? Not lovin' it.

Friday, July 26, dinnertime. This McDonalds seems notorious for poor service at the window.  They got the order incorrect.  Specifically, two mighty kids meals were ordered and they did not include the apples.  This is the 2nd time its happened to us at this same McDonalds.  We are better of going to the one on Folsom Street instead.

It feels pretty McLame-O to be writing a review of McDonald's, but they've finally pressed the wrong button one too many times.  The sign in the drive thru says "Open 24 hours".  Which at 3:30am, when I am on my way to work and there is not a Starbuck's open (that's a whole other review), is a really great trait to have in a Micky D's.  However, ...when I drive through said drive thru (that's right, I've got Meriam Webster spelling skills and fast food spelling skills, what what?), at 3:30 am they say they are not open.  This has happened to me on several occasions.  Sometimes they aren't open, sometimes the coffee machine is being cleaned, and sometimes the guy who is supposed to be working is getting it on with his girlfriend.   Well, at least that's what I imagine is happening; I'm very creative that way.  This McDonald's is a huge dissapointment.  I'm not sure I'll get over it anytime soon.  McDonald's on 30th and K, you SUCK!

The location is the best one in Sacramento...the problem is the only one that has not upgraded to a Modern Appeal ...the Restrooms needs to be made twice as big and much upgraded....they are usually very toxic to be used for children.

Messed up my 1 item combo meal again!! This is the worst McDonald's ever!!! Every time I go something is wrong!! It's not even hard orders just for me so 1 or two items.. If you go here expect to have problems it's the one thing they do well!!
24 hours , have always gotten my order right , and normally pretty damned quick service !  A+ for this mcdonalds!
Bummy location! But can't beat a dollar soft drink on a hot day!

I'm embarrassed that I eat this food as much as I do, but I am willing to put this aside to write this review.  McDonalds is unhealthy but it's cheap and I'm ridiculously broke, blah blah. You get it. Clearly I don't frequent this place looking for a mind-blowing culinary experience. I don't even really expect the people to be friendly or possess more intelligence than it takes to punch in my order and make it correctly. You know, kind of like going to Wal-Mart.  What I *do* expect is that the powers that be actually pay attention and try to staff the place according to usual patterns of business. Both Friday and Saturday nights are hoppin' at this location because it's 24 hours, which is awesome really. So WHY do you have an entire village of staff during the day and TWO people working the drive through on Friday/Saturday nights? It doesn't make any sense, and I guarantee you lose business because of it. You lose MY business most of the time, as I drive right past you and your 10-car-deep line to instead go to Del Taco where I *never* have to wait more than a few minutes.

I used to be a regular customer but when I came here recently I noticed that they reduced the items of the one dollar menu and now the refills for the McSweet Tea is now limited to only one refill per customer! No more double cheeseburgers for a dollar? What a rip-off! I am willing to give them three stars instead of two though because the cashier who took my order looked like Enid from Ghost World. She looked like the spitting image of Enid working at the movie theater taking orders from customers and making smart alecky jokes.
Never a long wait, just wish you didn't drive by homeless people whenever you are leaving the drive thru.
I hate, hate, hate this McDonald's. They always gip me on my order and they're so stingy with their sauces.  ...but, of course, I continue to go back. ugh. kill me.

My life partner and I decided to stop here on our way up to Tahoe this past weekend.  She got a fruit parfait for only a $1 and I --- being the man -- looked forward to ordering a vegan conforming organic salad with a side of Kiwi bottled spring water.  Much to my dismay, the waiter who served us was unable to provide such a meal for myself.  The sign out front mentioned that "Billions" have been served, which is totally mind-bottling.  It has been nearly a week and I'm still quite puzzled as to how this restaurant has achieved such a high volume of sales.  I'm from SF (that's San Francisco, California for all you people out there) and I have yet to have schmoozed with a person who eats fried potatoes and/or broiled hamburgers on a regular basis.  Even more astonishingly, the waiter in the previous paragraph gave me not a 12 oz bottle of Kiwi premium water, but some kind of clear liquid that was dispensed from some kind of faucet.  Rest assured that I have filed a grievance with the local Better Business Bureau over this establishment's flawed practices.

Sure.  There are a gang load of homeless folks with tents on their carts but meh...what are you gonna do about it?  It's midtown.  I like this one because: - It's open 24 hours a day - It's McDonalds, so you know what's on the menu. - $1 menu - The pre-op transexual/drag queen who takes my order at lunch time.  Lunch AND a show. Righteous!

Oh how I bemoaned the death of the Hugo.  69 cents for 42 oz of glorious soda.   I could swim in the glass.  It was perfection.  However, that seemed to be a summer only phenomena and the colder winter (and/or fall) months are forcing me to reduce my consumption of Diet Coke.  sniff, sniff.   This location was one of the first in the area to discontinue the Hugo and I've held on to a small grudge against it.  No more.  It is always clean and has reasonably fast service.  Plus, I am reminded that this is the only location in the area with 69 cents vanilla ice cream cones.  We're back on good terms now.  I'm off to get a cone!

OK, so it's freaking McDonalds! What the hell do you think I'm gonna tell you here that you haven't already vomited if you have eaten their crap food. Did you know that their french fries  cause more cases of perforated bowel than anything thing else known to mankind (according to 3 local surgeons I know). I guess if you eat enough of their crap food, your gut would bust! Just food for thought!  If you are eating this or feeding it to your kids, you should have your head checked, but then again, I'm a psychiatrist and I think everyone should have their head shrunk!

Duuuuuuude.  After a night of drinking, this place is probably one of the best drive thru's to go through.  They have greasy food to fill your drunken craving, and healthy options for the skinnies.  One of the last times we were here, my cousin took a sticker off of their drive-thru window and kept it as a keepsake.  What can I say?  She's from out of town and she's twenty-one.  Another time I was three drinks away from a DUI and I really, really had to use the bathroom.  This McD's location has conveniently set up a dumpster can right in front of a wall, which makes it perfect for ladies, like myself, to squat in private and relieve herself.  My bf did it too as soon as I got back into the car.  The bums do not bother me much, as I am a resident in Midtown.  The key is to treat them as they treat you.  Hell, ask THEM for some change, you know they have it.  Anyway, the only gripe I have about this and every fast food place is that most times they don't have shakes/ice cream available because they clean the machines at 10PM and don't want to serve those items until lunch the next day. L. A. M. E  Mc Donald's on K street: thumbs up, man!
I barely remember being here, but there were six of us piled in a cab and the cabbie was nice enough to take us here.  We had one of those crazy drunk orders and they got it all right.

I go to this McDonald's every morning at 6:20 am before work, they have gotten my simple order WRONG 4 times in the last month alone!  I do not realize it is wrong until I arrive to my desk at work already.  I order a simple breakfast Oatmeal with fruit on side and a hash brown.  3 times they have forgotten my hash brown all together and then today they put the fruit inside the oatmeal (then it is hot and nasty to me) I have called every time my order has been wrong and all they say is "OK", they have never offered me a refund of any sorry nor have they offered anything for free. I only work 2 blocks away from here but I will now be taking my service elsewhere in the mornings.

wow i just got a frappe and it was so delicious! i usually order it with carmel and mocha drizzle in the cup(yuuuum) and its never the way i want it, mcdonalds either puts too much or not enough. but when i got it here it was soooo good and im not saying that cause i used to work there but they were fast and absolutely great service thanks to the manager gloria, of course shes always doing such a wonderful job and so is karla i love how she runs that restraunt.

Are the orders getting. Bigger again?  Sure seemed as the medium meals were Large meals. Woe is me!  In any case their fries are the best still.  It has been ages since I went to a McDonald's but lately I have wandered in.  This one has a 24 hour drive through because it is near the Sutter Medical Center.  You will see all kinds of characters here; and several teenagers after they get out of Sutter Middle School.  It fits the mid town mold so you may expect to see vagrants hanging about; and I, expect, after hours drinkers from the bars nearby.

I have been to this  place many times. Not once have I been impressed. My argument is more for Mcdonalds overall. They charge you for sauce. Yes it is only 25 cents but its the principle. I'm pretty sure not a single restaurant does that except for them. I can understand if you are asking for multiple sauces, but when asking for only one?? Really?? They happily give you ketchup, but nothing else. I didn't even want ketchup, but they decided to throw a million of those in there and charge me for one single Ranch dressing. What is the logic in this? Is there a shortage of mayonnaise, sour cream, garlic powder, dill weed, milk, parsley, and onion powder.. And is there some sort of surplus of tomatoes I don't know about? A seinfeld episode comes in mind! Soup Nazi! But its the Sauce Nazis of Mcdonalds! I won't be going here anymore!
THIS MCDONALD'S IS OPEN 24hours!    enough said!  get the caramel sandae$1  !   or get the CHERRY PIE $1 !

That McSkillet Burrito speaks my language. I want to eat it for breakfast, lunch, and dinner.  But they stop serving breakfast at 10:30 a.m. I never thought I'd be as disappointed as they day I arrived at 10:45 a.m. Yet, let me be clear. I love their Big Mac. I especially love their luscious fries. But I don't know if I love them as much at 10:45 in the morning.

Honestly, ever since downloading the McDonald's app, I've thought about coming here more often. Which is not good (because fast food). But I decided to stop by for a quick lunch around 12pm on a Thursday. After looking through the app, I saw a BOGO deal on their new Chicken Tenders along with a BOGO deal on any size French Fries. So that's exactly what I went with! They had 2 types of chicken tenders, Buttermilk Chicken Tenders and Sweet N Spicy Honey BBQ Glazed Tenders, so I got one of each. I also got some Mac Sauce on the side which was a good move! Each one costs around a little less than $5. I also got a Small Fries (~$2) and a free one! In total, this meal cost me less than $7 which is great. The only caveat with using the app is you can only redeem one coupon at a time, so I had to do this as two separate transactions, according to the worker. The tenders were a good try and were pretty good, but I don't think I would get them again. The fries were solid, as usual! I can always count on McDonald's for that quick yet guilty-feeling meal!

Came here while on a road trip to Tahoe.  Upon parking and stepping out of my vehicle I noticed a porta potty smell throughout the parking lot.  The heat from the area intensified the smell.  The restaurant was clean inside and the food was good.  I tried the new Bacon Smokehouse burger.  Very tasty, I would order again.  I was distracted by how many employees have band aids on their nose.  I would have found it more appropriate to just see a nose piercing if that is what it covered up. A booger hanging out of their nose would be less distracting.

I ordered my little brother a hamburger happy meal. Opened the box for him and it came with the hamburger unwrapped and looks like it was biten multiple times. Yesterday, i got him a 6 piece chicken nugget and there was only 3 pieces in there. Looks like their staff has been eating the food prior to giving it to their customers.

Long line forming of orders, meh service, many people waiting... Ya took 13 minutes for 2 McChickens and people mad about the wait. Hire more minimum wage workers Should've made them walk out curbside

If I could give them -10 stars I would. I drove and picked up $20 worth of food, and came home to find that half my order was missing. Already very annoyed that I had to drive back to this McDonalds, I walked back inside, waiting for the rest of my food. The manager had the audacity to ask for the half order that was given to us,and threw it away in the trash. I asked how come he threw everything away and he just shot back a glare and snarly replied back with "you're going to wait for a new batch of fresh food," without any sign of apology for the missing food. This whole altercation ended up taking an hour  (accounting for waiting for the food the first time, driving back and finding that we didn't get every item we paid for, drove back here, talked to the manager, and waited all over again for our whole order when we just needed the other half). What a mess. Worst customer service.
Could this place any worse, slow slow slow. The manager has no clue what the staff is doing. Fast food should not take 15 min drive thru with one car in front.

I don't know what happened to this place but ever since they remodeled the service has been extremely slow!!!! I've had to sit and wait for a Happy meal and one meal! This is ridiculous. They used to be so fast. $15 an hour you say???

Just made a quick stop at the local McDonald's.  This review pertains to the service that I received while there.  Chris, the person who received and delivered my order to the table was personable, professional, and very service oriented.  Considering this is a fast food restaurant, this was a pleasant and appreciated surprise.  Chris would be an asset to any service-oriented business and McDonald's is fortunate to have him as a member of their team.

I like this location it's close by the house.. take a little longer during the day.. at night it's super fast. Food is good. The iced coffee wasn't that great the couple times I got it. But pretty good overall.

This is the slowest drive thru in the world. I'm sitting in line right now as I write this. It's been about 20 minutes, and four cars behind me gave up and left. Mobile order doesn't work because every item is unavailable. Completely unacceptable.  Went to try a mobile order a week later. No one brought the food out after 20 minutes. When I went in the store, no one knew about the order. Someone from corporate really has to put their foot down on this location.

If I could give them a 0 star I would, let's see, terrible service, super slow, they NEVER get your order correct, I don't even know why I'm writing a review for McDonald's, but just to WARN you, go to any other McDonald's. This one is bad. Their phone doesn't even work if you need to reach them.

I usually receive good service going through the drive thru, today I decided to rub in thinking it would be faster. Not only did I have to ask for someone to take my order Russell was not very friendly at all. Gave me a total for my order in the form of a question and looked at me and said "what?".  There are quite a few number of people waiting for their food. I do not recommend coming inside for service.

It's ok today, got fries and chicken McNuggets. Had to wait a while in the drive through, And the food wasn't as good as usual , maybe it was just really hot today I don't know I wasn't feeling  the vibe

With only two people in line still had to wait 15minutes for an order that ended up being incorrect. Cashier repeated my order correctly twice but still managed to get it wrong.  Less chatter and playing around and more customer service.

TERRIBLE At drive thru...... words cannot describe how awful this place is..... - "we stop breakfast at 11" (the menu display states breakfast all day) - "please park around the corner, we will bring it to you in 5 mins" (arrives 15 minutes later) - came home to find the wrong order in my bag. Stupid of me to not check the bag before leaving OR to have even returned here after my first awful experience last year.

This location has terrible service.   The drive thru is unacceptably slow each time I've ever gone.   The staff is rude and condescending as well.  I had a young lady roll her eyes at me when I asked for napkins that should've been in the bag to begin with.   I'll never come here again ...this is it.

I was very thirsty, so I thought I would get a "quick" ice tea but I was at the drive thru for 20 minutes just to take my order!!! I have never been at a McDonalds with a drive thru this slow!!!! Get it together Mickey D's!!!!!!
I've been here at different time and have to say it's slow service is the same each time . How can you have a drive service and be slower than in service ? This place is the opposite!

I wouldn't recommend this mcDonalds if you're in a hurry. The drive thru takes too long (20 minutes last time I was in it) they don't tell you anything about time or when your order is gonna be ready, they just look at you like your stupid for staring at them wondering where your order is.. anyway, I went in tonight, there's at least 7 of them talking and laughing and messing around and not paying attention to the orders. They messed up half the things in my order, when I tell them about it they get an attitude, and didn't even say a simple sorry about that when handing me my stuff. They just hand it off as if they're annoyed that i told them they messed up my order. This location either needs to close or get some better staff because this is too ridiculous for something that is supposed to be "Fast food". And clearly I'm not the only one who is saying this also.

They need to have someone from corporate come down and do a quality control check on this place. 2 out of the 3 times I've been here they got my order wrong. Wait times are longer than usual. It seems like this is the norm looking at all the other reviews.   How is this place going to have 7 employees working the floor with 6 customers all standing waiting for their food? The drive thru was completely empty. All the while this is happening 2 coworkers are standing idly socializing. The employees clearly aren't trained well and reflects the incompetence of the manager. I'm sure the sales to those 6 customers they just served with their 7 employees will make up for the cost of their labor. This place is going out of business. I'm calling it.   Also I'm sure there are many others out there who haven't complained about their order being wrong. No one wants to make a big deal over something as simple as fast food. I took the time to write this review to speak out on the behalf of those people.

I would give zero if I could, one star is too good. They consistently get my order wrong, ask me to wait in the parking lot after waiting through a long line, or the ice cream machine is broken. Once they had no carbonated drinks. But, the icing on the cake was being served raw hamburger. Yes, you heard right and I have the photos to prove it. Two raw quarter pounder meals. I drove back and the manager didn't bother to look, but did give me two cooked burgers and a free fry for my trouble. I called corporate and what did they do? Had the same manager call me to see if I wanted a replacement meal. Since I'm never eating there again, I declined.

Writing this as I sit in the drive thru and it has now been 14 minutes and still no food and no one has moved in line. This McDonald's needs new management or just SOMETHING! The drive thru takes about 30 mins with only 3 cars.. And I'm only writing this review based on multiple visits not just one visit to make things more fair. Every time i come here to grab some breakfast there is always something missing !!! I'd rather drive a few more minutes to the one by target next time so that I get everything I pay for.  Came home and of course something went wrong. As you can see I asked for Bbq sauce and sweet and sour. Well I didn't get EITHER !!! Instead they gave me ranch. How hard is it to read an order and get it right !? It's hard to understand these type of people when they want to get paid $15 an hour but can't seem to follow simple directions. I will now be coming back to this location even though it's only 2 minutes from my house.

This locations managerial and customer service is the worst in a fast food spot I have EVER experienced.....the drive thru stays busy especially on the weekends and is always slow.....I order my food to be made fresh each time I go and every single time I get home my food is not fresh...... Either something is missing or incorrect or the biscuit is hard as hell and re-heated in the microwave....and when you say something about it they want to look at you sideways like you did something wrong.... They also keep the phone off the hook at certain times so when you try to call and complain you can't get thru.....but their first question to you when you do finally get thru to someone is "Did you call"...???? MY THING IS....IF YOU DONT LIKE YOUR JOB....GO PUT IN THE WORK AND FIND ANOTHER ONE.....!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
It is slow.  Slow on ordering and getting the food ready.  Seem like the staff here have focus issue.  It wasn't like that a year ago.  Mgmt needs to work on correcting the issue.

This is the worst McDonalds we have ever visited! The drive through got the order wrong and then we had to remind them of the price difference. Then he told us not to worry about it that "I got it". We asked to speak to the manager who condescendingly said he probably meant he had it right now. Either way, the customer service is terrible and the place is so poorly lit! Avoid it at all costs!!

3 Stars for the effort. I know that this place had been really slow, but I see that they have been hiring to fill up the position. But there is still no excuse imho, I blamed on the Manager, Supervisor leadership here. The floor leaders are terrible on leading and managing the floors. Oh well, I think they will get a little bit better. Food is the same.

Back at 1 star.... quality slipped into the basement... seems like food is prepared WAY in advance and reheated when ordered... Coffee is still hit or miss on if it's going to be hot... Final straw...pricing... post the price...live or die by that price.... I'm sorry (not sorry) someone was too lazy to go out and update the board.... not my fault... could I  have covered the price difference? 30 times over with the change in my cup holder. But if you're going to treat me like I'm stupid and slowly read my order back to me very slowly...TWICE.... then this place is lost forever... it's a shame that I can get the same order from a location across town ( E.G Blvd East or Bruceville  @Walmart) and still have higher quality and hotter coffee by the time I  get to the office which is less that 300 yards from the Harbour Pointe location.... do us all a favor... close this location down... it's obvious  no one here cares... let a business that actually gives a damn about quality  and customer service  move in....

The staff is a bit slow here.. I came in about 9 am because I thought it would be faster than the drive thru. I walked in to see 5 people with tickets waiting for their number to be called. The cashier seemed new. I normally wouldn't mind waiting whatsoever but this was before work and people go to McDonald's for something cheap and fast!
"Fast" food? 20+ minutes to get a single order of fries? Whom ever owns this franchise should get it taken back by McDonald's corporate.

I saw the manager yelling at a women in a wheel chair.    This female manager was so rude the fries are always cold and it take forever for you to get your food.     And the owner doesn't care.   I'm never going there.   Mcds should take its name back
The drive through area in this location is a little strange. And the customer service in the drive through area is slow. And it's nicely located close to the school and freeway.

Walked to our local McDonalds with my toddler and I was not happy with the cleanliness. The floors had garbage everywhere and tables not cleaned off which was hard for me to find a clean table for us.   The service was friendly and great which always are when I go through the drive thru. Should also focus on presentation. Hopefully on our next walk in visit it will look better.

This McDonalds is horrible never been to one that works so slow!!! No workers,and they don't even have ketchup or napkins or straws for you to get next to fountain drinks. Horrible service. Never again
Would give 0 stars but that wasn't an option. Only have 4 orders inside but they are so freaking SLOW!!!
The slowest McDonald's I've ever been to.  The drive thru was about 15 cars out and moved horribly slow.

Turns out the posted closing time is more of a suggestion. Tonight was the second time I've tried to get food and find out they closed more than 15 minutes early without offering any explanation. They just said, "we closed early, sorry".

I only come to this location because I can walk to it. This is my last time. Waited 10 minutes to have someone take my order and I was the first person in line. A man whose order had already been taken said he had been waiting 30 minutes. The floor, and drink counter were dirty and after 20 minutes, I still didn't have my order. I requested my money back and went elsewhere. The bad thing is that this happens often. Terrible. Get this manager some help!
Been sitting in the drive thru for almost 15 minutes.  If we didn't already order and paid I'd leave!

Warning! Do not come here if you expect to have get quick service. The drive thru wait was over 15 minutes long and dining ng is even worse! This place is always like this. Management needs to figure how how to run shifts!!!

Worst service ever.  This is one McDonalds I will never be stopping at again.  Went through the drive thru and paid with credit card.  The cashier apparently swiped our card twice before telling us that the card declined.  Provided a second card while proceeding to call the credit card company to find out why the card was declined.  The card never declined and in fact was charged and approved twice for the same meal that was then charged a third time to the secondary card provided.  Manager refused to talk to the credit card agent on the line and we are still sitting here waiting for our food and refund 30 minutes later.  Watch your credit card statements if you eat here and pay by credit.  I'm not about to pay $25 for 2 breakfast sandwiches which we still haven't received.

I've only gone through the Drive Thru here, but they always take extremely long. Longer than any McDonald's I've been to. I only go here because it's the closest one to my home. Hopefully they'll build another one near here because this one's service is just too slow.
Slowest McDonald's I've ever been too! Waited inside for 10mins for a hamburger and small fry and it's not even crowded.

This is McD of choice on my way home from work. Out of all the McDs off I-5S and I-99S, I pick this one because the other closer to home do not make their food items right. At least at this McD, they know how to salt their fries.  However, this has a busy drive thru almost every Friday night.  So far, I haven't had any issues with the staff or food at this McD until the other night.  They forget an item of mine when I ordered through the drive thru. I drove away and once I got home, they forgot it and I was furious. I called and called and no one answered. Eventually I got hold of someone and they definitely understood.  I still like this McD and hope they don't mess up orders usually. I think the employee was distracted because he told me my nuggets will be ready shortly so I thought they had my fries ready, but they didn't.

Stopped here for lunch with twenty-five kids on our way to Summer Camp. Our kids are pretty awesome and well-behaved but still, it's a ton of kids smearing ketchup all over their food and paying with more coins than cash lol. The manager ended up handling our orders and spoke to each kid like the paying customer they were. She was kind and even brought out extra water cups for the kids that needed them. The entire team was very kind to the kids and the orders came out super fast! It was an excellent experience and we are thankful for the awesome staff that made kids camp that much more fun :)

They need to shut this place down. The service was absolutely TERRIBLE!!!!!!!!! I worked at McDonald's years ago on Latina blvd and it was much more efficient. I took me almost 30 minutes to get my food.it gets better. I go inside for my food and this dude stares at me at sweeps instead of taking my order. RIDICULOUS. Never coming back. EVER.

This location has always been sooo slow in service. So I hadn't been here in awhile but today I thought I'd give it another go. Again, I was very disappointed! Several customers waiting with tickets in hand. Customer service lacking any friendliness and my burger looked like someone tossed it in the air before packaging it therefore it lacked appeal and taste. May be quite awhile before I go back. They need better training for their employees. I highly recommend Carl's Jr across the street. Very well trained staff and good food.

I figured, being on the better part of town, service would match its location. wrong.  Seeing these reviews makes me wonder if management needs to be changed.   Ordered from drive thru, picked up food, girl appeared to be in hurry and closed window.  I waived the girl down, she pretended not to see me until i honked. I asked for a cup of water, she said she couldn't because other drinks were already in line?  I asked if anyone else can get me a simple cup of water she said i would have to come in.  I'm at drive thru for a reason.  I drove off in utter shock at the lack of service. Ks#13 is on the receipt but not sure if that's the girl at window 2 who served me or the friendly cashier at window 1. She is a young Latina. I really hope she is talked to and customer service is strongly emphasized because she had none.  Not coming to this one anymore, esp since management hasn't contacted me regarding the issue.

The slowest McDonald's ever! I was second in line to order, so I thought it wouldn't be long to get my food. Wrong! The girl didn't know how to give change correctly, she had to call someone over because she didn't want to listen to me telling her what she owed me. Then my milkshake sat there, and sat there and sat there. When I asked for it, the guy said I had to wait for my whole order. Needless to say the shake wasn't thick any longer. I had to ask for a new one.  They had about 6 crew behind the counter and 3 on break. But that didn't stop them from chatting to each other across the counter. 20 minutes to get my food. smh

This is the shittiest McDonald's ever. Don't go here if you expect to get your order right. They always fuck it up in the drive thru. I'm never going here again. They have done things like not close the drink lid all the way and the whole thing fell on me while handing it over. Today was the last straw. First they were giving me someone else's order and when I told them it's not mine they gave me part of my order. I was like I order another mcchicken. So they looked on my receipt and they never put it in. So I offered to pay and get the other one. And the manager was like then you have to park your car and wait. What the hell!! You fucked it up so why should I waste my time. The right thing to do was just throw it in for me. The manager looked like she doesn't have any customer service skills at all. Never apologized. Seems like their hiring criteria is people who don't give a shit.

I just wanted to say thank you for great customer service today! My sons and I came in for breakfast and he barely touched his food. I cleaned up our mess and neatly packed our food. We went to use the bathroom but when we came out someone had thrown it away.  The lady who was cleaning the lobby said someone else may have thrown it out. She confirmed with her manager and gave me another of the big breakfast I ordered as a courtesy. Thank you team!

I've come here a few times before and waited in a 30+ minute line thinking it was just a fluke. Each time mind you I have come off peak lunch hours and still have had to endure the crazy wait. Today 230pm I have been waiting for 16 minutes and my wife decides to pass us coming home from work and drive to the next closest Mcdonalds and order. Not only did she make it to the other Mcdonalds, but she ordered and made it home before we even got our food which was another 18 minutes later. If you have the chance just keep driving by this one. They are by anything but fast food.
Over 3 years and dozens of visits I've come to avoid this place. The majority of orders are wrong. Food is sloppily prepared. Drive through wait is excessive. Walk in hours close too early.

Only one star because I couldn't review with no stars. This location must be the dumping ground for new and bad employees, including managers. The manager took my order, after I paid she walked away without giving me the receipt, which included the order number. I thought she stepped away for a second, but she never returned to the counter. A few minutes later, another employee came to take my order - told her I just needed my receipt. The manager also filled my order, which was wrong. Service is very slow, appears no one has any training in customer service or production.
The prices are marked up than other franchises.  Other than that, it's the same as any other McDonald's.   and as always, *Review will be updated based on future experiences.
Rude. They hardly have a drive thru menu and when deciding what we would like the person in the drive thru told us to complete our order, they close in 2 minutes. Which they did not.

I rarely write reviews but wanted to share my experience that I had today.  I'm standing in line and there's an employee taking orders.   The place is not busy.  The employee takes one order and then waits for the order to be completed before taking the next.    While we are waiting another customer leaves.   We have yet to be acknowledged.   Another employee who appears to be on break walks up to the register with her wallet in hand.  She then motions to another employee and proceeds to place an order of hash browns  in front on me.     I told all of them that we are in line and had yet to even be acknowledged.  All we got was a dumb look.   Never ever going back here

I been at this location for the three weekend because my grand daughter likes the hash browns a sausage biscuit. One cashier for drive thru and one on the window. The service is so slow. I live in this community and we spend our money here and can't quality service. I spoke to duty manager and her response was we don't have enough staff..Ten minutes to get my order. That a dam shame and the line is getting longer as I write this comment.

WORST McDONALD'S EVER. This place is the model of incompetency.  We live within walking distance of this place and occasionally pick up dinner on busy nights out of necessity.  You say "apples", your receipts says "apples", you open your bag and find...fries. Limp, undercooked fries. If you are lucky to get all of your order at all.  There's nothing like getting home to find out your kid's happy meal is still sitting on a counter somewhere. Don't ever order breakfast outside of breakfast hours, unless you like gray eggs and are okay with getting some dental work done after trying to bite through their English muffins. Be prepared to wait, wait, and wait some more. For being a place that counts pickles on burgers and hands out napkins by the sheet, they sure have lost sight of the purpose of their company. 1 star for their ice cream and because Yelp makes me.  Visit at your own risk.

This McDonalds has a nice interior and food always tastes the same at all McDonald's.   My review is on the cashier that just took my order. He was taking forever to give people their change. Finally it was my turn and realized he was 12 cents short...not that 12 cents means much to me...but what bothered me was he was doing it to everyone!   I told the manager and the cashier said he ran out of change to give to customers. So his plan was to keep giving everyone the wrong change because we he was out???
Ordered a crispy snack wrap with no cheese and got a sloppy grilled snack wrap with cheese that looks like it was taken off and tons of ranch...gross

This has got to be one of the worst McDonalds ever.  The owners should seriously consider hiring someone with at least some competence to manage this place.  The staff are ill trained and ridiculously slow.  Each visit, you can expect some sort of a wait.  Waiting on the fries to be ready, or coffee to be made...etc    If your meal has fries and you're one of those weird ones who likes to have it with ketchup, make sure you ask.  Because they will NEVER include them.    This is the first time where a McDonalds is this poorly operated.  I can't blame the staff as they are generally nice.  They are simply ill trained or whoever manages the places doesn't know what he/she is doing.

Ok, I have to remember this is a fast food place. When I first walk in there is a line & I observe there are at least 3 customers waiting but no one to take orders. There were at least 4 employees who were packing orders & 1 of them was standing around gabbing with one of them. I was able to make eye contact with the one & I asked politely, is anyone taking orders. She looks at me & nods her heads & walks off to the back. I was a but confused at that point & didn't know what just happened.  Was she going to hide so no one else would complain or was she truly going to the back to find someone.  After standing around fora other 5 minutes finally someone came out. At this point there were now 3 additional customers behind me & 3 in front of me.  One customer came & left after noticing no one was being helped.   I was in kind of a rush wanting to come in & get my & get out.  I wanted to order a Cheeseburger Happy Meal.  No idea what was taking so long.  There appeared to be plenty of employees but no one taking orders.  There were even 2 of them sitting down at a table eating.  So beware when you go to this location that you will have to wait. No quick service at all.    Oh yes, I should add check your orders. Previous occasions (which I has not yelped) orders were messed up.  Even missing a patty from my Big Mac.   Will try to avoid this location if possible or just try going at an off time. Maybe that will help.
Spent $9 on a disappointing quarter pounder and two sausage burritos. You'd think for the poor quality it would at least be cheap.

Order a kids meal and it's over 20 mins to get it. Service is extremely slow!!!  Maybe drive through is much faster.  Do not go in the restaurant. I'm not the only one experiencing the slowness. See other review also. Worse McDonald's ever. Never been to a slower McDonald before.
Terrible terrible service!!!! If you go inside expect to be ignored. They only serve the drive-through. They might as will just close the door and do drive-through only! Never coming back!!!

I only gave one star because I had to. They have signs on. It's their drive thru windows that day additional sauces .25. I asked at the first window for additional with my money and she acted like I was asking for diamonds and told me I need to give it to the people at the second window. The poor young man giving me my food told me sorry no additional sauces. I told him let me talk to the manager and the manager proceeded to tell me no sauces. So I'm suppose to know at the time I order how many or what kinds of sauces I may need. Ridiculous. So I told her either the sauces or refund me back all my money. Stupid all that just for two additional sauces that I was willing to pay for. Never again will this establish get any of my money.

I typically don't write reviews for chains like McDonald's but the poor service at this particular location warrants it.  Had two recent visits.  First visit was a few weeks ago, we took the drive thru.  The hot cakes in the big breakfast with hot cakes were not hot but cold and hard, probably an old batch.  Also we were not provided utensils.  Luckily I checked after pulling out of the drive thru and had to run over to the counter to get a set.  Second visit was today.  Again we took the drive thru.  I ordered a big breakfast with hot cakes.  They asked me to pull up and park and they would bring out the food.  Ok, that happens, no problem.  Waited 5 minutes.  Waited 10 minutes.  Walked into the place, showed them my receipt.  The girl at the counter then casually gathered my order as if I had just ordered and paid, not knowing that I had been waiting in their 'reserved' parking space for the past 10 minutes.  This McDonald's is conveniently located next to the I-5 freeway, but I will go out of my way to drive to another McDonald's from now on!

This McDonalds is one of the newer ones in Elk Grove. Right off of I-5 so it's convenient if you are on a road trip and passing by. Parking near the entrance has some spots but there are more farther away. Drive thru entrance is around the building and there isn't a concrete barrier to guide you so you have plenty of room to navigate.  Inside McDonalds is more modern looking than others. They actually have different furniture at some locations. You do have your standard tables and chairs but there is one area in which it's more of a lounge. Came in to order 2 happy meals and the cashier was super nice to us. Knowing we are adults and just want the minion toy, she made a conversation with us saying she would have done the same thing with a smile on her face.  Food was the usual tasted the same as others. Nothing special just fast food. So far I have no issues with the drive thru and I hope it continues that way.
Going through the drve through the guy that  took my order had a bad attitude his name was Nick
Waiting 25 minutes at this point. They won't give me my money back so I can leave. Toilets are overflowing with 2 inches of standing water. How is this possible?

The worst! I have actually been in the drive thru and had a car drive by yelling how bad the service is. I hardly ever go to fast food and this place reminds me why. Nearly every time I go here there is something wrong with my order or I have to pull ahead and wait. Just today I ordered 4 hot fudge sundaes and a large fry. All 4 sundaes had the fudge all over the outside of the cup and lid, there was more chocolate on the outside than in. Not to mention my fries were half filled and what was there was cold a soggy. I doubt I'll ever go back.

Stopped by McDonald's for lunch. Ordered a sausage egg and cheese mc griddle meal with a orange juice and breakfast sausage burrito. 10 minutes later my order came out. Ask them where's my orange juice? I tried to call the store to get the name of the assistant manager I was talking to and their number on yelp doesn't even work!!! The assistant manager, which is a Mexican lady, told me they charge me for a Diet Coke for the drink when I told the person that took the order I wanted orange juice. And if I want an orange juice they have to refund my money and charge me extra for the orange juice. It's not my fault one of your employee put in the wrong order!!! I don't have much time left on my lunch so I told them they can just keep the drink. I rather die of thirst...this is not the first time this McDonald's mess up my order...no wonder this place have 2 star rating on yelp...worst McDonald's customer service ever!!!!! I would rate them 0 star if I can!!!

This mcdonalds is awful. NEVER GO THROUGH THE DRIVE THRU. Avoid this mcdonalds in general if you can. Awful staff , awful service. Took 15 min to place an order inside cause cashier seemed to have no idea what she was doing . Staff was in no hurry at all. Avoid this location if possible.

Soooo, JUST KIDDING at McDonalds serving breakfast all day. Only corporate stores "may" serve it, but after waiting 30 minutes in the drive through line, they informed me they serve a VERY limited menu during non-breakfast hours! Rat bastards!! WTH??

Been here multiple times, live nearby. Swing by in an emergency. Never never never get anything right. Huge line at drive through, Space people were pulling out and leaving. Some were driving  some were driving to the front to go inside. I did the same. Employees were just meandering around not really doing anything. No one was helping anyone at the counter. Waited for five minutes a whole bunch of people were just leaving in disgust. I ended up leaving without having anybody even greet me.
Waited 24 minutes for 10 piece chicken mcnuggets.  24 whole freaking minutes. Thought this was fast food? Go to the mcdonalds down the street.

Dreadful. .   I've had consistent unpleasant experiences at this location, however, an incident today was far too much.  I came in earlier today for breakfast with a friend, I knew what my order would be and couldn't have imagined it to be such a hassle for the cashier.   The cashier was Alexander (Alex) who asked what I want to order in a stern voice, I simply replied in my most courteous and general manner, "An order of the hotcakes without sausage and one sausage mcmuffin, I would also like to request a fresh order please."  He looked at me dead center and chuckled a bit, then proceeded by saying, "Well, it is fresh. What? Do you think it just comes out of a box?" *chuckling continues*   I didn't say anything and just brushed it off, I couldn't even believe how disrespect this individual was. Honestly, customer service aside for a second, have you any decency? I was far more courteous than I usually am just because of the frequent discrepancies at this location. I then check my receipt and immediately notice that he put in an order for a Hotcakes w/ sausage order, c'mon. .   You want to disrespect me and then mess up my order? I made it very clear and there really shouldn't have been any confusion, it wasn't at all busy in front either.   I had to tell another girl working who then gave me a refund back on my debit card, which is quite a hassle because now I've got to wait to retrieve the money the cashier made me lose out on.  In short, I simply don't feel welcomed by this location in the slightest anymore. I'm just shocked really, to top it all off the cashier didn't even manage to press the "ask me" button which displays whether or not the cashier requested it as fresh or not.   My advice: At the very least, you should give and receive mutual respect, especially as an employee.

The worse MC Donald's . IT'S DIRTY DIRTY DIRTY. I had to WAIT 10 min and no one took my order.  I asked them to clean my table 3 times and they never did. The manager is lost.   Doesn't have any idea what she's doing.
The manager is the worst cashier. Managers should be leading customer service examples for  their employees.
Coming here is only when I'm really hungry and have nothing left to think of to eat. They can be really stingy on the Mcflurry. Depending on the day the burgers and fries are okay.

Great location! Conveniently located off of I-5.   This place is relatively new, and I can tell they need better training.  The customer service is great, and the food items are also always good. BUT, they almost always seem to forget something. Today, they forgot my daughters juice box for her kids meal. Weeks ago they forgot her go-gurt. And everything before that I can't remember.   So needless to say, when you pick up your order from the drive thru, double check your bag.

The drive through will take you at least 20 min every time. Writing this review sitting in line. I stop at this one more than any other location because it's close to my house, not really enough of a reason to come anymore

The worst McDonald's I have ever been to in my whole entire life! I went thru the drive thru today and ordered 4 McChickens, a large fry and a hamburger happy meal. First off it took us 20 mins in the drive thru from the wait time to order our food and getting our food. (There was only 4 cars in front of us) then when we get our food, they forgot to put in the sweet and sour sauce that I specifically asked for. The large fries was not even filled to the top and the meat for the hamburger happy meal was so small I thought that they forgot the meat.. Never coming here again, nor would I ever recommend anyone else to come too.

I felt that this McDonald's deserved an update. They fixed the app issue and now accept the coupons, which I appreciate very much. They usually get my orders right, but once in a while, they'll make mistakes here and there, which would be great if they could work on that. But overall, it's a nice McDonald's to go to in the area, and I usually visit this location fairly often.
Slowest Mcdonalds ever. Its suppose to be fast food. I think the girl at register was new. On the plus side my order came out before the people in front of me. :)

It's Christmas morning and the staff are here on a holiday to serve hungry patrons.  I read many reviews here and have not had a similar negative experience.  On the contrary, I see a very clean and well kept restaurant.   The manager looked like he was taking extra care in cleaning even the trash can lid.  Surprising that the Manager would take the effort to do  the tiny details  that ultimately make the restaurant a welcoming place.  The appearance is much better than many McDonald's I have been to.   The employee behind the counter, Jacob,  was very competent.  Single handedly taking care of the entire front counter with efficiency and very courteous.   Impressive job being the boss of the front counter.    A big thank you to this crew for working on Christmas and still being friendly,  courteous, and efficient.

So-called "24-hour" drive through. We pulled up to the window around 3am and there is literally a sign by the drive through window saying "24 hour drive through! Open all night!" And the woman at the drive-through mic told us "sorry. We don't open again until 4am. Come back later" like what?! Are you serious? FALSE ADVERTISEMENT. Do not expect to come here for a late night meal! They are NOT 24-hours like they say!

This location is extremely slow. Idk why but every time i come here it takes forever! And thats inside and the drive thru, they both take forever. It seems like their whole staff is new. But on the bright side the food always seems to be fresh when i order.
Been to this location a few times and not once have they gotten the order right. It's worth a drive across town.

Rude service, bad customer service. Waited 10 minutes for a special made hamburger for my daughter. They forgot to make it. Really? To top it off manager was rude and offered nothing for my convenience. Called the 1-800 number they gave me and left a voice mail twice and I have to get a response. I don't think a supervisor even exist. To top it off there prices are higher than other local McDonald's. Stay away!!

Just got a sausage egg mcmuffin around 2pm just cause they started doing it all day. Well, it tasted like it had been sitting out... All day. The muffin was harder than the jolly rancher I used to get the taste out of my mouth.

Soda was about 3/4 of the way full, had me wait 10 minutes for 3 burgers because buns were frozen, 1 cheeseburger had no ketchup, no onions, and the bun was hard and completely inedible...will drive farther to the other one next time.
I usually think of this restaurant chain of being dirty, but this location is the opposite. Very clean, prompt service and modern decor. Bravo McDonald's.

In the handful of times visiting this location, not once has their shake machine worked.  I don't think they have one, or don't know how to use it.  12+ cars in line at 6:00pm, crew is slow as molasses. They can't get a single order right. Prices and tax don't ring up correctly, they overcharge customers. Staff are incompetent and customer service doesn't care. Don't waste your time or money, go somewhere else.

I go to this McDonald's regularly because they're just around the corner from my house. Service is generally very good.  Workers are for the most part friendly and seem well trained. Food is typical McDonald's.  Don't think I can tell one McDonald's food from another.  Stopped by there yesterday to get food to take home.  I ordered a Big Mac and asked for extra sauce for myself.  Sausage McMuffins for my wife.  When I got home I looked at my receipt which had fallen out of the bag in front of me and which I usually just toss.  I saw that they had charged me 37 cents for the extra sauce.  WHAT??!!  For just one dollop or squeeze of the sauce dispenser?  How CHINTZY can you get!!!  Is there gold mixed into your "special" sauce?  Does it take that much EXTRA EFFORT to make one additional squirt of sauce?  I mean C'MON!!!!  Thirty seven cents is nothing but just the idea of squeezing a few extra cents out of folks that regularly come into your restaurant is galling to me.  Had to drop one star because of this!

ELK GROVE - What was supposed to have been a happy meal at a McDonald's restaurant turned unhappy for a woman eating with a group of mentally disabled adults.  "They're people like we're people, so they shouldn't be discriminated against," said Constance Gastinell who works with developmentally disabled adults through programs that help integrate them into the community.  Gastinell sometimes takes some of the adults to a McDonald's on Elk Grove Boulevard for lunch, but the last time they were there she says the owner kicked them out. "He came in and he said, 'well you guys, you can't eat here, you have to leave.'"  She said the owner told her they couldn't stay because they were conducting 'business.'  "We weren't conducting business. We came into eat. We had no paperwork; we had money to buy," said Gastinell.  But McDonalds says there was no discrimination. In a statement issued to News10, Dennis and Vicki Caldwell, the local owners of the restaurant, said, This recent situation involved a food fight within their group, and disruption to our other guests.  The Caldwells added it wasn't the first time such an incident has occurred.  We have consistently attempted to work with these guests and accommodate their needs as best we can, their statement read.  Gastinell says there was no food fight and her group was well behaved.  "We went in to eat. We weren't disruptive," she said.  She feels they were told to leave because they were mentally disabled.  "I did feel as though they were targeting us, although he [the owner] says that he wasn't. Being kicked out, how else are you supposed to feel?" Gastinell said.  Soon after she was asked to leave, she rounded up her clients and left. She wants others to understand the stigma that surrounds people with disabilities.  "When you see them hurt, it hurts you. That's why it's personal," said Gastinell.  While Gastinell says she will continue to defend her clients, she no longer plans on going to the Elk Grove restaurant.  News10/KXTV  - Having a mentally disabled daughter, Kathryn (pictured), this story drove me out of my mind. People have no idea how hard it is, just to go out to a store or restaurant or anywhere. We get the stares and the looks, sometimes from children, more often from adults. We've all seen the group of four or five disabled folks being assisted by a health care worker, going around a store to get some things or sitting at your local restaurant, just wanting to be like everyone else. I wish Elk Grove were closer, I'd like to chat with their manager. I hope "big" McDonalds is paying attention to this particular franchise, as how individual restaurants and employees treat guests is a direct reflection of the organization as a whole.

McDonald's are no longer really kid friendly. The people here are rude. They don't have paper towels in the bathroom to dry hands. They never give you any ketchup unless you remember to ask, when they do give you napkins, they give you like 2 pcs. Ummmm... I have two kids. You really think 2 napkins are enough? They hide everything now. No napkins, no straws, no ketchup, no paper towels in the bathrooms? Really don't like going to mcdonalds unless I absolutely have no choice.

THE WORST MCDS EVER!!!!!! Do not go here! Spent 20 mins ordering 2 meals! The guy at the window had no idea what we were asking for. They had to get a girl to help him and she still didn't know how to place the order. Went up to pay after all the trouble and they didn't have the two meals we wanted. This location seriously needs to get some new employees or train your employees better! They told us they weren't serving a certain breakfast item after 11am, it was 11:02am!!! If I wasn't sitting in the drive thru for 20 mins maybe you could serve me what I asked for!

The food was cold, the restaurant looked like a bomb went off in it, it was 3:30 PM, so no rush hour excuse, I asked the counter person, Jean, if he or someone could wipe off my table, he said yes, but at 4:05 PM, no one got to it? If Hell is frozen over, is the only way I would ever eat hear again. Classic, the counter person, Jean,  just came out at 4:07 PM, and sat at the next table and still hasn't  cleaned the tables. Jean needs to be fired.

Nicest, cleanest McDonalds I have ever been to. Staff was so friendly and helpful. My son spilled his milk, and the person who can to clean it up almost seemed excited to be able to help. Even offering several times to get him a new milk. I'll drive across Elk Grove again to come here.

Nice location, now the people around here can drive shorter distances for their big mac and lard filled fries...   It's really clean and modern inside, check it out. It is weird how the restrooms are in the middle of the restaurant, not secluded at all.  The drive thru is really efficient and there's a great plus side. It isn't a secluded drive thru where you have to stay in that line, because it's just a lane that wraps around the back of the building... so if you change your mind and don't feel like getting fat today, you can easily turn out of the lane and get on your way to the gym!  If you don't know what I mean, just give it a try. Drive here, bike here, jogg here, walk here... just don't order calorie massive meals please. I actually had their crispy chicken salad, with balsamic - it was amazeballs for a drive thru salad.
Awesome!!!! Brand new. Killer location. First day open today! Everyone so nice and efficient. So glad for this location.

One car ahead of me today and it took 10 mins. No lie. I live down the street  and come here a couple of other times and took as long or longer. Thus is the last time I come here. I will drive 5 miles to the next one.
This drive thru is a joke! I don't know why I wait 15 minutes just to order and then 10 minutes to get my food. It morning time, they should know people what to be in and out.

Restrooms were clean, but as it was only 9:30am and the kid wanted a meal that came with a toy, no dice.  (Her attempt at ordering was met with the second cruelest word in the English language: "Sorry," but at least didn't accompany the most cruel:  "no.")    Purchase anticipated, but averted as not much on the breakfast menu is toddler compatible.

I was amazed at how well this new location has been performing.  The staff (specifically a young lady with red hair who took our order) was extremely kind.  Rarely do I give reviews to drive-thrus but the staff at this location definitely out-shined other McDonald's (and fast foods) that I have gone to over the past 20 years of my life!  Food-wise, I am always a tester of new flavors that restaurants try to push, so I decided to try the habanero ranch quarter pounder.  Although it isn't as spicy as the name would implies, it was tasty nonetheless.  The deal menu is always a plus and speed of service was blazing fast!  More importantly, McDonald's have come along way in making their menu more friendly to the calorie conscience!  Just wanted to give kudos to where it is deserved!

I hate to be so generous when reviewing a McDonald's, but this one definitely deserves more than 2-stars.    Can't really review the food as, to me, McDonald's food tastes the same at all McDonald's.  So food-wise, this one isn't any different than the McDonald's on Mack Road.    What I'm giving this place 4-stars for is the location and the look.  Starting off with the location, it's nice to finally have a McDonald's nearby that isn't inside a gas station or one that's 15minutes away.  It's right off the freeway and isn't in a busy intersection or a busy shopping plaza.  Really a prime spot to get good business without getting overcrowded.  As far as the look goes, it's really got this super modern look to it.  Doesn't really feel like a McDonald's at all.  Trendy furniture.  Trendy wallpaper.  Trendy layout.  Not to mention there's TVs on the walls that actually show TV shows instead of the McDonald's menu (although they do have TVs as their menu board).    Overall, really glad for a closer McDonald's for those random big mac and nuggets cravings and especially for a McDonald's that actually feels nice to go into.

I go to this location cause it's literally down the street from my house but I don't think I'll be coming back any time soon if at all. Last week I went and got cold fries and water down ice tea it's all I ordered. I figured they were just having a off day. At 130 today I drove through there drive threw. There was only three cars ahead of me and the wait was like if I had twenty cars before me. I had two children in the back seat. I checked my bag off food and grab the happy meal for my son assuming it has everything in it. Shame on me for assuming. Taster a true right there at the window and they were cold like they been sitting for hours nothing worst then Coke McDonald fries then I got home to realIze they didn't put the fires for my son in his happy which mad one very sad two year old. Lucky his mama shared her nasty cold mc Donald fries with him. Then instead of sweet n sour like ask they gave us ranch. Mc Donald's fires are my favorite fast food fire but no more from this location. Very disappointed

The inside is really nice but their customer service is horrible. The wait is ridiculous even though they have a crew of 10 in the back and barely any people. Also the drive thru is always ridiculously long, because they take so long. And one time I was waiting for 20 minutes in the drive thru and I got unsweetened iced tea instead of sweet tea. All that trouble for NOTHING.

McDonald's food is all the same so no point talking about it.  However this place is dirty from the unkempt  tables and the soda fountain area never clean and a sticky floor.  There are hundreds of McDonald's in the area... Avoid this one.

Let me say, I understand its a McDonald's, but I went there to order a Mocha and they forgot the expresso and the chocolate. I arrived at work when I tasted the coffee, so immediately called the McDonalds at my earliest convenience. When I called I let them know, and manager advised the the did not believe me and wanted me to bring the coffee in. I advised he I threw it out, and condescending tone at the time just turned me off. I decided the three bucks is well worth the knowledge of where not to go.

We went here last night around 8 pm to get frappes to find out they were cleaning the machine. They werent serving frappes at the time. We cancelled our whole order thru the drive thru and went to a different location. Very disappointing.

I'm glad they open this location right off of I5 on Elk Grove. This location has always gotten my orders correct as do most McDonalds would always forget something in my bag. The lines here are usually very long at the Drive thru and its usually a pretty long wait. I for one has always been a big fan of the "Big Mac". Who isn't? Add on a large sweet tea and your set to go! Well, not just yet! You must also order your hot crispy delicious McDonald's Fries! =) Now you are set to eat! Enjoy!

This McDonald's sucks! I work close buy, so often times I just want to get s large iced tea. I'm always waiting. I asked my co workers who grab lunch their from time to time and the general consensus is that this location is slow!

Thank you for providing good food thats going to kill me later, as always mcdonalds. This will along with cheap prices will keep me as a faithful customer. The serivice, cleanliness, food, and design are great. However the AC is friggin terrible, its literally like sauna in here. Its nicer outside than it is inside.

Disgusting grilled chicken snack wrap. Not only was it drenched in honey mustard the consistency of the chicken was as if it hadn't been thoroughly cooked. It had this gross crunch to it. I spit it out and threw the whole thing away. Worst $2 I've ever spent.

This morning I was there for breakfast. The guy who took my order sounds like he is fairly new, which it is fine with me. When I approached at the pickup window, I waited for 5 minute w/o any knowledgment from the staff. I saw her was cleaning the coffee station. Finally, she opened the window and asked me what did I ordered. I was pissed! I mean why can she ask when I first arrived at the window. I gave her my receipt w/o a word.   Then few minutes later, she handed over my mocha. I took a sip of it, and it was NOT sweet at all. Then I asked her why my mocha was not sweet, and she said did you ask any flavors to put in it. I said, "no, I just ordered a regular mocha." Then she said, "oh then that is right, so do you want more cream to it?" I was speechless, WTF who put coffee creamer to mocha?!!!!!! I was short on time, so I asked her to give me couple packets of sugar instead.   On top of that, they gave me one harsh brown short. My kids were very up-sad.  I got so mad and tried to call to make a complaint. Here is the best, their phone number was disconnected! WOW!   I wanted to give no star, but Yelp doesn't have that option.

Easily the worst McDonalds in the entire chain. How can it take nearly 15 minutes to get through the drive thru? Ordering inside is just as bad. I have been boycotting this location because they have stolen so much of my time but recently I was asked to go pick up some food from here. Never again. I will drive out of my way to another location and make it home faster than a trip to this piece of garbage location. I don't understand how corporate can let the same owner run this store for as long as he's been able.

Extremely slow every time we go. Also did not even get our order right after waiting for 20 minutes and closed early for "maintenance" and closed even earlier than the time they said they were going to close early at
One star because zero isn't an option! This McDonald's is NOT ALLOWED to do any substitutions! Why would I ever come here again? Simple answer I Won't!
this mcdonalds is trasssssshhhhhh. the best employees have been fired. general manager needs to get fiired instead. veronica is rude disrespectful and lazy.

This place is a work in progress.  It's a really nice location and brand spanking new, but the workers need a bit more experience.  Having to wait 30 min for an order in the restaurant and then have the order incorrect (missing one burger, wrong sauce for the nuggets).   I wasn't the only one too as I saw two folks come in after going through the drive thru and getting incorrect orders.  Give them a few weeks to work out the kinks...
MUCH improved over the location that was on Harbor Point. The fries are always fresh, hot and perfectly salted. The drive-thru seems fast and efficient. No complaints at all!

This store should be ashamed of themselves for treating those adults they way they did.  Incompetent managers, should be fired on the spot.  The store should be shut down.  We in America are so against the discrimination and bullying of so many groups, yet handicapped people are almost the forgotten group.  We all have to meet our maker one day, for this manager, may God have mercy on you...

So I'm updating my prior review Marissa in the back window of drive-through always pushes the cars through quick in and out thank you for letting me get to work on time on a daily girlfriend keep up the good work

The memes are true, the ice cream machines are always down.   Seriously I'm not even kidding this sucks I'm literally stuck in the middle of the line not getting anything cause the ice cream machines are down and now I gotta wait to get out of this mess

Very bad customer service. Came inside for breakfast which I was the only one in the store. Took 20 minutes to get my one meal and the cashier seemed like she hated her job. It was so uncomfortable. I asked her what toys they had for the happy meals in hopes in buying one, her response was simply: "I don't know". I was gonna ask for a refund after 18 minutes of waiting but 4 other people came into the store within the 20 minutes and was standing around the counter. Never coming here again.
