Went in and waited at the counter for someone to finally help me. After the manager went in the back to "find them" they come back and say they don't have any gift cards. If this would of been communicated to me in the drive through, there wouldn't of been as much of an issue. Everyone was extremely rude through the entire experience. Will never come back.

most mcds are a hit or miss. this one seems more of a miss when we visit. from messed up orders, stale fries, lukewarm customer service... the misses often tally more than the positives. after a recent multi-state summer road trip heading home, hours being on the road, bleary-eyed and trying to stay awake, 100 miles from home i decide that my reward for making it to stockton safely would be a mcd's breakfast. fluffy pancakes, savory sausage, steamy eggs, nummy -num bfast burritos, and washed down with a cool, tart, orange juice. for miles i persevered, forcing my eyes open and focusing on my goals of safely arriving home and feasting on a well-deserved mcd bfast!  60miles to go... im nodding off but my sweetie is trying to start a conversation to keep me awake. 40miles to go... my eyes hurt and i SO MUCH want to go to sleep! i push on... 30 miles to go... i don't know how i ended up this far, but i dont think i cut anybody off or caused any accidents.. 15 miles to go... my foot is pushing down harder to "keep up with the traffic, shhh!" 3 miles to go! i can just taste the savory goodness of mcd's bfast and soon, i can see the turn off for trinity parkway! we made it! my adrenaline kicks in, im so very close to my prize! we roll up into the mcd's parking lot, and see that it is devoid of many cars. the inside looks dark. its only 6am? we try the door, but no, luck, the dining room is closed... FUCK YOU, MCDS! i didn't want to order from the drive though, i wanted to get out my my car and eat my bfast inside! from my other experiences at OTHER mcds, their dining rooms opened as early as 5 am. whut gives? sullenly, and angrily, i leave this mcds. it will be a long while before i return to this establishment again.. TOO many disappointments! minus all stars if i could!

Always come at 9 o clock, the door has been locked 3 times on 3 separate visits. I have checked online for the hours for the lobby, it says they close the dine in area at 11. I dont understand why on 3 seperate visits they have locked the door before 9.

Terrible, awful service from eye-rolling, jerky staff. The food was ridiculously awful. The fries were re-dipped, cold and congealed grease corpses. I asked for ketchup, got an irritated "Sure," from the sarcastic robot, and she gave me exactly NO ketchup. The sandwiches sucked. I paid for extra sauce, and got smears only. I found out all this after I got home, of course. I wasn't about to go wait another protracted period to get my problems addressed, probably with the extra of their spit - no charge. So I just figure I will break my arm before I EVER go to this craphole again!

I find it funny that every time we come to this McDonald's for a milk shake after 6pm I would bet my life they would say "the milkshake machine is broken" I find it way too ironic that the last 5 or more times it's been "broken" this has been within a 6 month span.
Took a whole basketball team there today and they took very good care of us,  very efficient.   Thanks

McDonald's in Trinity Parkway in Stockton, California.   I come to this location from time to time to have a drink and chill outside. I really do love outside seating and I just love drinking a coffee or a tea here. I normally only order drinks here.   It's slowly has been becoming one of my favorite McDonald's. The staff is cool but nothing ever stood out. The places is very clean when I come here.   Tip: Free WiFi.   So yeah I'll be back be when the weather gets a bit warmer. It's a bit chilly Willy outside right now.  You know me I review anything and everything. Because that's how I roll :)  Vincent D aka VD aka Vebola aka Vincent Vega.   Enjoying the simple things in life.

So after waiting in the lobby for 20 minutes for our order I decided to go inquire about our three meals. Apparently they forgot about our ENTIRE ORDER. So after waiting another 5 minutes we got our order. One item from all three meals was screwed up. Oh yeah, and there was a hair in my mediocre, barely warm fries. A few weeks prior to this incident I wanted a couple cheeseburgers on my way out of town. Ate the first one just fine. And the second had no meat. IT HAD NO FUCKING MEAT. It was a godamn grilled cheese with ketchup, mustard, and a pickle. Fuck McDonald's with a passion. I hope they go out of business someday. And fuck all the incompetent morons that work here. If you ask me I think they should go back to making $6.50
This is thee better McDonalds for this area. The people have consistently been friendly. And the food is good. Bathrooms are clean each time I've been there.

Before ordering I asked about my coupons & how many I can use, I was told as long as there is more than one person in the car to use that many. There are 4 people in my car @ that time so i ordered, drove up to pay & of course  manager tells me I can only use one coupon per transaction! Ok, I'll just do 2 separate orders then. I pull up to window to get my food & my order is not complete! But of course the young lady taking my order did not get it right, so I had to make a 3rd transaction!!! Ridiculous, just ridiculous.

This is the worst location I have ever been to. How do they hire the most ghetto people in such a nice area. The manager hires as much family as possible and their accent is so hard to understand.  This is by far the most ignorant and rude McDonald's staff I have ever encountered . They will argue with you about anything and everything and never admit they are wrong. This place is absolutely disgusting and they employees act like third world refugees. Sloppy, gross, dirty. They really need to have a REAL manager step in. This staff is going nowhere in life. Even the managers have the mentality of a small child. No matter what sandwich you order it will always be sloppily thrown on a paper and you will have to redo it yourself. NEVER leave without checking your order they NEVER GET it right. When you try to fix it be ready to argue. The customer is never right and you will have to pay.

If I could give ZERO stars, I would. This is for the McDs outside of Walmart. They almost screwed us out of a whole meal. They forgot a bag with a burger and fries, and when we told them, they gave us the bag with the fries dumped out in the bottom of the bag because it was lying flat under the burger box. The nuggets AND the fries were grossly stale. They forgot my son's apple slices AND his juice in his happy meal. They accidentally gave us four large drinks. What the hell? I was livid. It was 10pm, they weren't busy, what was their deal? They suck. Never going there again and telling all of my friends and family never to go to that one. I mean, why is it even there? The one inside Walmart is a quadrillion times better!!!

Best customer service i have ever received at a walmart location! They keep it clean and greet the customers with excellent care. Especially Mary very observant to costumer care. Its rare to see employees that cares.

I live close to this McDonald's so this is the one I always go to. The people there are usually friendly and fast. This is my problem with this specific place. In my opinion McDonald's has the best fries among the fast food places when they are hot and fresh. I feel they are much better than what the other places. That being said when they are cold and soggy and stale they are just gross. I understand that every trip there will not land when they fries were just cooked and I would expect maybe a 20 percent chance that I will get some bad ones. At this McDonald's I get gross, cold and soggy fries every single time. I am not kidding. I go to this place more than I should and I have never once been given fresh fries.   Another thing I like about McDonald's is that they always have good Coke. I do not know it if's different or no there but it always seems to taste better at McDonald's. This place drops the ball here too and the Coke always tastes like they hooked it up to the diet Coke by mistake or something. It's terrible.   I am a little surprised that I am tapping out a yelp for McDonald's but this has been bothering me for a while and today they forgot to put my pie in the bag and they gave me a hamburger patty instead of chicken in my sandwich. I was not happy about that but when I called to let them know the number they have listed only is answered by a fax machine.   Go to Wendy's across the street. Maybe you will have better luck.

My review was for the quality of the food. Even though your fries can be served hot (in my case they weren't the first time around), they're sad and soggy as if the heat of the oil wasn't hot enough to develop a nice crisp. Also, both their Big Mac and Buttermilk Crispy Chicken were disgusting. Meat patties weren't warmed up/cooked long enough and the chicken was very dry and bland. Went back for a refund without any problems. If I were to rate the quality of service I received upon my refund I would give this place 4-ish stars. Mike (branch manager) was very accommodating and refunded my money with no questions asked. He also gave me another meal for the  inconvenience. Overall I'm pretty certain I won't be coming back here. The quality of food at this location has been a letdown to McD's. Drive the extra few minutes and find another location that can live up to the brand's name.

This place is not in ghetto but they sure hire some ghetto people working here. You would think they know how to filter out people when they hire and of course their manager is even more rude. When we drove up to order two 20 pieces of chicken nuggets meal and we couldn't decided on the second drink and when we just go we both of the same drinks. The girl got the nerve to say in the speaker phone to us "oh my gosh!" After we ordered. (African girl taking the order) When we got to the pick up window I asked to speak to the manager about how we don't appreciate her employee's attitude. All she said to us was "ok!" (Asian manager) Now we wonder who train all these people with customer service?! Date on duty (01/22/15 10pm) when we got home our fries was over salt. We know they did it on purpose because there is no such thing where our fries is covered with salt. They don't even deserve a star at all!

I usually don't write reviews for stuff but I have to for this place. I know it's McDonald's but come on? I've been here multiple times. It's one of the better tasting McDonalds, but they always mess up my order! 3 times to be exact. And the third time they made me pay 10 extra dollars for a sandwich I didn't even get(luckily for them I had to be on time for work) and didn't even know that they did it till it was to late!  And yesterday I went and bought a double quarter pounder an they actually had the meat underneath the bottom bun! Haha. The morning time is good and night time is good. They only mess up orders around 4pm so I wouldn't want to go there then. Besides that there food taste good which is why I gave 3 stars instead of 2.

I came here on a Friday night right after work.  I ordered 20 McChickens with 2 BQQ sauces and 2 Sweet and Sour sauces through the drive through.  It took me 15 minutes to pay.  Then they asked me to pull into the parking lot to wait for my food.  It was at least another 15 minutes until they walked my food out.  They then didn't give me the right sauces.  I waited another 5 minutes for the right sauces.    Huge issues with this McDonald. They may need to hire new or more help!

Extremely disgusting on the weekends. I gave this place a second change today and was even more disappointed. Nats and flys are covering the soda and catchup dispensers. The same employee who was wearing safety gloves to clean the ice cream machine also served my fries. So my fries had milk all over. There is a bucket that reads "waste" that was sitting on the counter directly above the cups they give to customers. The ladies who work here don't show the same type of professionalism and work ethic I'm used to at other McDonald's store. The fries were burnt today.  The counters hadn't been cleaned even though it was noticeably un-busy.
Slow, unprofessional! Manager on duty on 10/29/14 is rude, sloppy dressed! Just plain rude
What a nice location and building. The staff was so friendly and the food was awesome. I really like the fact that they said Hi to me as I walked through the door. It was also very clean

I'm not a frequent visitor of McDonald's to begin with. This particular location however has some of the slowest staff I've ever seen. The excel at not engaging the customer. Looking everywhere else except at the customer. The few glances you do get are never ones that feel welcoming or appreciative that you are a customer in their location(using the word "restaurant" would be an insult to other actual restaurants). The staff never says hello or welcome and I think that they are well trained in never saying thank you. Heaven help you if you dare ask for anything additional like napkins, straws and such. Medusa had a more inviting look on her than the staff that works here does.

Service was great in the beginning but has seemed to diminish in the last few times we have stopped by. It ranges from forgetting straws/napkins to forgetting our fries. My latest problem is not getting the sauce I want with my nuggets. They always assume we want BBQ sauce and even when I tell them sweet 'n sour, there is always BBQ in my bag (are they pre filling these bags or what???)  We will still come by though, because of the location but will definitely make sure our order is complete before leaving. They are usually pretty fast when it comes to ordering and getting your food. The inside is also fairly clean but has a weird seating arrangement. Bathrooms are decent.

NASTY NASTY NASTY this Mcdonalds deserves - stars. Today i saw an employee SPIT into the garbage can behind the register & next to the coffee & ice cream machines while walking to the bathroom. She did that right in front of the customers! I can imagine what else goes on in that Mcdonalds on Lower Sac. The manager was told & did nothing about it. The garbage can was not removed while i was there 30 min and the employee went about her job. Spit speads and carries bacteria & diseases !! When I talked to the manager and asked for the area consultants number, she refused to give it to me and got upset and started yelling at me saying that i had no reason to complain about her because she didn't do it!! What type of management is that?  NONE !!!!

This happens to be one of my favorite McDonald's in Stockton. I know that everytime I come here, my food is hot and fresh, and I am greeted as soon as I walk in with a genuine welcome and a smile and the store is always clean! I've never had a bad experience here, although I have learned not to come during the after school rush! The managers always seem so nice and friendly and really engage in helping out anyone that needs it.
Always check your bags before leave this place. Horrible at getting your order right. Huge mistakes by this franchise

They have messed up on their services one too many times. It would go from forgetting an item that we ordered to not including our order on the bill to the point where we would have to go up to tell them and they'd have to ring us up on a new order. It really pisses me off when they get the sauces wrong especially when I go through a drive through and I tell them SPECIFICALLY that I want HONEY MUSTARD AND RANCH but somehow I either get all ranch and no honey mustard or all honey mustard but no ranch. Today, they forgot to include my McChicken + they only gave me one of each sauce. One honey mustard and one ranch for the orders of two chicken nuggets. HEAVILY DISAPPOINTED.

First off this location does not even deserve a star.  I had placed an order inside the Walmart Mcdonalds. Turns out my youngest son does not like onions. I normally just order chicken nuggets for him but today he wanted to try out a cheeseburger. I had already left the walmart parking lot and figured ill just go to this location to swap burgers so I dont have to take my childrens in and out in this heat. I ask to speak to the manager. I told her if I can switch burgers and get the new one without onions. The manager named Courtney said no because the last time she did that to a customer her store supervisor name Farrad got mad and she got in trouble because she replaced an item for the customer. He told her that because the purchase was not made there at the location they will be losing out of money to replace anything even if its for a swap or to correct the item. What kind of management are they running here at this location?? Ive gone to another Mc Donald location when one restaurant has messed up and gotten a replacement at another and never had a problem or a response like this. Im very upset and how Courtney could not even be hospitable into taking care of a Mc Donalds customer. I definitely will not be coming here again and would not recommend anyone to come here with this kind of service.

Screw this incompetent riddled festering of a McDonald's location. How can a nice area in a part of ghetto Stockton have some of the most dumbest employees possible? Not ALL McDonald's are like this store. There is ALWAYS something wrong with my order. Something missing, be it fries, sauce for McNuggets, onions on a burger that says NO ONIONS. Etc Etc. Sloppy presentation, gamble on the freshness of the nuggets and or fries. Like WTF? Just because you work at McDonald's doesn't mean you shouldn't take pride in the food you make and present. I've worked in the food business for many years prior to being a high functioning registered nurse, and the quality of my work and ethic has never waivered -  be at a Panera Bread or hospital with sick babies. And as a to-go cashier through the drive through - IT is YOUR job to make sure EVERYTHING IS CORRECT IN THE ORDER before giving it to the customer. Unacceptable POS location.

I'm giving them two stars only because the food is always hot and not just warm. However this is the third time I ordered chicken nuggets, 20 pc btw, and they gave me only ONE sauce! Are you kidding me! And I always ask when I pay does it only come with one and the cashier will say no it comes with 3-4 even though it shows one on the screen when you order. I hate ordering nuggets here. It's a long shot but I hope corporate or the manager of this store reads this and retrains those shitheads that always put one sauce for a 20 pc mcnuggets
Not to be mean but some of the employees here are plain out stupid. You dont charge a customer who ordered food already for a small cup of water! Idiots plus they take forever making my food.
This has to be one of the worst McDonalds ever, when they first opened, it was questionable, maybe a 3 star review. Now, I would be leery to order an ice cream cone, or a soda from this location!

Brand new mcdonalds located near the Target on trinity parkway. This is your standard Mcdonalds but with a 2 lane drive through. Will stop by possibly for a late night snack from my drives from modesto to sacramento.

Location - hood. Panhandlers next to drive thru order box or by the window to pay just out of sight of employees. I don't judge people on how they live but come on, this is ridiculous. Day or night it's the same. On this visit I almost ran one over because he walked right in front of my car as i pulled from the window.  Again, I love some McD's Fries and had to have a caramel sundae.  My orders can be hit or miss but it's in a central location.

I have been here a few times and today was just not a good day..meaning the employees. I totally understand it was lunch time and they are overwhelmed with all these customers waiting for their orders however a few of the employees were not helpful at all. I dont think i will return to this location. I used a mobile coupon and the guy said i can only use one. I told him which one i wanna use then. He didn't fix it but pretended that he fixed it. My total came to the same. After i paid and looked at my receipt, i realized he didn't correct it but i didn't wanna get in line again to tell him since there was like 10 people in line. Service was slow and staff was not customer friendly. Then, when i got my order and was ready to walk out, realized i didn't get my drink and had to get their attention that i didnt get my drink and the  staff looked annoyed and gave me a large cup of ice with little tea...omg, you all get paid to do ur job just like i get paid to do mine so do it with a smile.
Bums are allowed to sleep in the booths. The manager is kinda bitchy too. Lots of bums allowed to hang out in parking lot also

Ordering anything at McDonald's that contains ice cream is a joke. The ice cream machine is broken more than it works. You should do us all a favor and take ice cream products off your menu cause you don't know how to keep the machine in good working order

I would give this a minus star if they had one.  I don't recommend this place to your worst enemy.  Panhandlers inside, outside. Place not safe.  No security.  total mess up the order.  The owner should do everyone a favor and close the store.  It is only a matter of time before someone gets hurt or even killed at this location.  Bums sitti in the booths being loud and one sitting in a booth with his worldly possessions and the trying to pick a fight across the dining area.  Don't come here it is not worth you life.

Honestly, it surprises me how often they mess up your order. If you want a sandwich hastily thrown together that you may or may not have ordered with cold, undercooked fries then this is the place to come. I like McDonald's food, but this is not the location to come to.

**Edit** Ok, now I know why there's so many 1 star reviews for this place. I went inside this time and getting harassed by black homeless people for driving a nice car is not a pleasant experience. The staff is great- the sketchy people that hang around there? Not so great. Best choose the drive-thru if you intend on coming here- if at all. Not worth getting mugged or worse over some fast food.

This mcdonalds need some type of security.brought my daughter her to get a happy meal but had to leave because a homeless lady with no shoes came an sat in the booth WITH US asking for money an i said sorry cant help you..then she comes back to ask if she can use my phone. The employees seen her going around asking for money but didnt ask her to leave..i dont understand that..

Since I changed my lifestyle around,  I rarely eat fast food anymore.   But hey, I was on vacation last week and I fell off my diet lol. I like this location a lot.   The Masses will claim,  it's dirty, or stinky , to many panhandlers,  it's in the hood and much more. But hey, I don't judge anybody. People are people in my book.   I'll say this, I come to this McDonald's for a coffee and sweat tea.   Enjoying my time talking to people. I never once came across any problems with my orders or cleanliness when I come.   I search for places that make me feel comfortable and this McDonald's makes me feel comfortable,  so I'll comeback.  Vincent D *VD* Life is Beautiful
Worst service ever! Got in line for some 6 cookies and waited more then 15 min at the reserved parking never coming back again

I came here last Sunday in the drive thru at 10am. Ordered the bacon egg cheese biscuit meal add sausage and 2 sausage egg mc griddle meals for my kids. My biscuit was hard, sausage was dried, and the egg was rubbery. Did not taste good what so ever. I checked my kids food and same thing with the sausage and folded egg. I would of gone back to complain and get fresh ones but I was on my way to drop off my kids to the babysitter and then headed to work. Very sad to see how much of a poor quality mcdonalds has had since the past years has gone by unless its just poor management running the kitchen area. I would not recommended this area at all. Im not saying all McDonald's are bad but this one is the worst one that ive gone to. Good customer service that I had but food was not good at all. And its not like breakfast was ending in a few minutes. There was still 30 mins left til it was over.

If I could give 0 stars I would.  We went through the drive through and ordered cheeseburgers 2 with onions 2 without.  Waiting, waiting, finally get our bag and start driving away.  I look in the bag. Umm No cheese on half and No onions on any.   UGH, what is a cheeseburger without cheese?  Gross!  We pull down a side street and receipt in hand go into the store.  The employee ARGUES with my boyfriend saying the order is correct!! Um no he shows the receipt shows cheeseburgers, the bag of cheeseless burgers and the no onions on the two burgers.  He asks for everything to be remade since it is now 15 minutes later.  Finally he comes back out to the car it has been another 10 minutes.  I start digging in the bag. Umm still no onions on any of them!!!  They still got it wrong!!! So freaking frustrating.  How hard is it to get four cheeseburgers right.  Make two as the menu states and two without onions.  Give me a break.  Also everytime we go here they give us the drinks overflowing with soda dripping down the sides and we have to ask them to wipe it off or for a napkin.  I have added pictures previously.

Because I can't give it zero. No ketchup, no receipt, buttermilk chicken on the sandwich was over cooked possibly recycled from yesterday.  Fries were not the fried I associate with McDonalds they were cold an limp NEVER again!!

HORRIBLE.  I dont expect much from a McDonald's in Stockton but believe it or not we decided to come here instead of the one on Wilson Way for obvious reasons.  Its a beautiful building and the staff is very nice but they do NOTHING about the 5-10 homeless people who hang outside or come inside and bother you.  Seriously, the person I was dining with kept telling everyone that came up and asked for money "Sorry, I don't speak any English".   It was the funniest thing I heard in a week.  If they were to figure out a way to control the gang-bangers and homeless beggars INSIDE the restaurant I might go back.    Till then, never.     :0)

Service was terrible. Restrooms were unavailable due to 2 I think Homeless People who were cleaning up. My order was wrong after waiting about 30 minutes for my food. There was security on site. I was so happy to leave because it was very scary. I will not be returning!!!!

McDonald's workers are pieces of garbage, and bags of hobo piss. They gave me a old a** parfait and at first they said they didn't have one, so when I asked for a refund they said they found one . I'm sure they just didn't want to give me a fe fund and found it in the garbage. Hope you all get cheese bugger aids.

Last time I visited this Mc Donalds I went inside to order. As I was in line I witnessed a worker sorting buns, pickles and other items bare handed! He was wiping sweat off his face and brushed his fingers over his nose while doing this. The manager, a woman, was standing there talking to him like nothing was wrong. When I called to complain she informed me that she would "speak to him" but tried to brush me off. I also want to point out that when I called requesting a manager, someone tried to lie and say he was the manager. After I asked for a name he handed the phone to the real one. The manager at this location has NO control obviously and doesn't care. This happened on October 8th around noon.

This is easily the most disgusting McDonald's I've ever been to.  The restroom was nasty, like an old blanket, garbage and feces all over the place.  A restaurant restroom is aways a good indicator of the cleanliness inside the kitchen.  I left right back to my car without picking up my food, I wouldn't be able to get myself to eat it.  I'm surprised that McDonalds allows this establishment to be open/ run as it is considering all of the bad experiences everyone is clearly having at this restaurant.

The ladies are great in drive thru.  Maybe it's the hours I go.  Maybe because I go with 10 minutes to spare just in case it's busy.  Oh lol maybe cause I worked on drive thru 3 yrs in the 90s and know what the inside is like.
waitied ten minutes in a empty lobby for a mcmuffin. Seriously. Never coming back.

Only reason that I have one star is because I have to give one. The worst place ever! This review isn't a "one bad visit" kind of review. Oh no! I have given them chance after chance taking into consideration that sometimes stuff happens. Well this is my last time I throw my money in the garbage (literally). The chicken is always dry and rubbery; The hamburgers are dry and old. To top it off, everything has been cold. Each. And. Every. Time. You try to tell them so they can fix it and you get attitude or are told that that is how it's made and they can't do anything about it. You know, I've even called there "how are we doing" 800 number and nothing has changed. It's a horrible fast food place. With 2 other fast food chains within a couple blocks from them, my money will be better spent elsewhere.

This is one location that will screw-up your drive-thru order 98% of the time. I ordered the 20pc chicken mcnuggets - only had 1 sauce in the bag - for 20pcs 1 sauce - call the location talk to the mgr on duty @ 3pm who tells me that it is policy to only give 1 sauce even for a 20pc ... go figure ... I really dislike this location as well as the management ... only go if you wish to be screwed

This McDonalds is the worst! The service is bad. They never give you everything you order and then when you tell them they forgot an item or in many cases more than one item they tell YOU to double check before you leave! Really?! How hard is it to look at a screen and put something in a bag? I've worked at McDonalds in my youth and know it's a fast pace job but  it is part of the job to make sure a customer has what they order. They are paying for it after all. Although this McDonalds is closest to me I Will stop going there. I've been there many times and have had to turn around and go back almost always to get items they forgot to put in the bag. I only gave 1 star because you have to check one or else I wouldn't give any.

If you like waiting a long time, not getting what you ordered, being harassed by druggies, and getting half filled Mcflurries that cost $3.45+, then this is your place.  Otherwise, spend your money somewhere else.
Unfortunately lots of flies in the restaurant today. The meth heads are annoying outside but I don't blame the store for that. The flies however are something they could control.
We stopped here for a cappicinno and latte. It took FOREVER, they couldn't get the order correct. Miserable.  The whole concept of "fast food" is speed.

A true dump. Awful employees who lie to your face, gross food, and hilariously long wait times. Oh and while you're waiting twenty minutes just to get some chicken nuggets, you get to hang out with Stockton's finest crackheads as they  knock on the window of your car demanding change. Avoid and go to one of the many other restaurants or fast food joints in the area.
Worst McDonalds ever they cannot seem to put a piece of fish between two buns and center the meat and cheese so annoying like they just don't care

My son and I went on an ice cream run this evening. We ordered a vanilla cone, two Sundaes and a blizzard. We waited 8 1/2 minutes from the time we paid to the time we got our order. The really disturbing part is that my son and I watched the girls laugh and joke and One even went so far as to get her phone out of her back pocket and show the other something on it. They were way more interested in their conversation than fulfilling our order or any of the orders behind us. By this time I would say there were at least seven cars behind me. Ridiculous and that's what you get when you hire immature people and leave them alone to run your store. You get what you pay for. Maybe the managers should think about hiring people who are a little more mature, rather than trying to save a buck by hiring immature, inexperienced kids who  are driving people away from your business. This is the first time I've been there in the evening and I guess I was hoping for different results than I get in my very rare drive through experiences in the morning. The customer service is always horrible. Too bad McDonald's. I would give a zero*if I could.

This is the worst McDonalds in the city. The workers here are the worst around. I live about a mile away and drive to a farther one after having 5 out of my last 6 orders were screwed up, and it was not the first stretch like that. The line is long most of the time and moves super slow. If you do stop here at least go inside and check you order before you leave, but drive to another one if you can.

I kinda want to tip the cashier. She was so perky and polite for 7:30am and although the drive thru long was super long, it went by incredibly fast. Idk how they're making those breakfast sandwiches so quick without it looking like a mess. I was not expecting to be impressed by a McDonald's in Stockton of all places but damn it, I am.

We were recently at your location. I went to use your bathroom. One of your employees come in, used the facility, and LEFT W/O WASHING HER HANDS. This is disgusting and deplorable!! You all make food and should wash your hands before serving the public. There WAS indeed a sign that read "Employees MUST wash hands before returning to work". Do you enforce this policy??

This McDonalds has spiraled down hill slowly since it opened. They consistently leave something out of my order. Whether it is an entire burger or dipping sauce for nuggets. The last time I was there I went through the drive through and they told me to park because they needed time to complete my order. No big deal at all. The problem was when they brought out our food to the car and we took it home the entire order was cold. I live less than a minute away. Don't have me wait then serve me cold food. How does that work??? I am taking a few years off from McDs thanks to this location. I would rather spend a few extra dollars and take my business somewhere where they can consistently get it right. Play at you own risk at this location. Took me multiple times of getting burned before I learned my lesson. How many times will it take you...
Well, I learnt my lesson about going there after 10pm. My fish sandwich was so dry that I think it sat a while for being served to me...next time I'll know better. Be warned...

The worst customer service I've ever experienced at a McDonald's! Workers were chatting while customers were waiting for their orders to be taken. Took them about 20 minutes to give out my order (one cheeseburger) with 0 customers in front of me. Really disappointed. Never going back.
The first day they gave me a mcdouble so greasy I could squeeze oil out of the paper onto the table the second day they kept trying to hand me the wrong stuff I didn't order horrible place to eat.

No matter what day or time I come here, it's like Carmageddon! I can never fully pull up to the speaker because the car ahead of me is scared to move. The lines are wrapped around the building. The service is usually quick. Prices are consistent with other McDonald's in the area. The place seems clean.   I don't like that it's attached to (and shares the restrooms with) the Chevron gas station.

This place is the worse in America. Whats the point of mobile app order when u wait longer than going there yourself and ordering? Waited 20 mins and no one came out. Had to go inside and the bitch cashier said i had to wait longer in my car. This was on 11/17 @650pm.

This McDonalds is better than the one on Northgate by a lot. However, if you spend your money here, don't expect to get what you pay for. On a busier morning, they will short you on everything you order. This morning I ordered two McMuffins, two sausage burritos, two iced coffee drinks, and two hash browns. I waited 20 minutes in the mobile order spot with no sign that anyone was coming. Finally someone did, and both my drinks were only about 75% full. It looks as if part of them had been spilled. Then when I got home and was happily ready to eat, I found neither of my mcmuffins had any cheese whatsoever. My husband's burritos had no salsa with them. The hash browns, which in my opinion are expensive for what they are, were floppy and old. Very upset. You can't expect consistent service.

This is my go to McDonalds location.  I have been a customer at this location for as long as it has existed.  So I am a regular.  I have always been treated with respect and they tolerate my special offerings.   Getting to the chase... the food is average McDonald's and the crew here is above average. Sure team members have come and gone. Such is life. The newbies have to learn the register and their crazy extensive menu items and combo.  The darn menu has alot of items...mc cafe drinks, breakfast items at breakfast and all day breakfast, value items, happy meals with options, al la cart vs combo, desserts, salads, seasonal items, mc specials... and so on.  Way more complex than In&Out. Plus they have to deal with frequent rude, intolerant, inpatient, unreasonable, or darn out mean customers.  Trust me, half of the time I order inside so I witness the patience and professionalism of the staff in handling the customer bullies.  Shout out to Andrew, KS at the register also to the AM weekday crew.

I like McDonald's but this one is always a gamble when it comes to your order correct (strictly for drive through, inside is much better). I went to buy 2 happy meals on Tuesday 10/30/2018 and seeing that my wife normally buys it, I forgot what sauce my two year old likes off the top of my head. I asked the girl over the intercom what sauces do they have again to see if hearing it will drag my memory a bit. She immediately let out a loud sigh and tried to whisper "oh my God" but didn't realize I heard it all. I asked her if asking for sauces was such a big deal for her to be so rude and she continued the conversation like it didn't happen. If you do not like your job do not take it out on the customers. It really is simple as that. I actually complained to the guy in the second window who tried to apologize but he more seemed amused (albeit a bit shocked) that his colleague was rude to a customer. If we never had a long day and was actually traveling later I'd have just continue driving through the drive through and to another location. You only get two stars because the people inside are better at customer service and actually getting your correct order to you. But the drive through, especially that girl that worked the intercom at 4:30 pm on 10/30/2018 is really atrocious.
I can only handle the breakfast, but that drive thru line is horrendous. Definitely not FAST food. Guess I'm not the only one the likes there breakfast.

Honest, good customer service in the drive-thru.  I've gone here just a few times now, through the drive-thru and so far it's always been a positive experience. The last time I went, they messed up my order (honest mistake) but corrected it on-the-fly (basically with no issues).   They didn't argue with me, make me pay extra, or get mad. They simply gave me a free French fry because that's what I was missing, and explained to me the miscommunication.   That's it!   Super nice, and I told them I understood the mistake and appreciate the service.

Will say I have mixed experiences here but recently I had a young lady be rude to me over 34 cents I was so mad I complained and days later the owner actually called and apologized   It was nice to know the management is hands on and cares I recently seen them hiring new staff also so I think they are working on the service to get it better for the customers , counts as a lot to me thanx again management for your help and showing the customers you listen

Let's start with saying this is the worst McDonald's ever, they gave my child a cheeseburger with no pattie and we waited over 20 minutes to get a correct cheeseburger. When I went up the second time to remind them they acted like they didn't know why I was waiting ? McDonald's is always busy I get it but we asked for a cheeseburger not a grilled cheese and waited patiently. Just a little annoyed because this always happens. Second time I visit I went inside because line was around the gas station and o was only ordering a iced coffee no biggie. WOW worst decision ever. I had time to do a couple of scratchersget my lotto ticket at chevron and wait in my car at least 5 minutes came in and everyone that was behind me already got there food and everyone in the line in drive thru already had died down. So I'm sitting waiting and they ask " have you been helped" adv I'm waiting for my coffee she said "oh" walks away and didn't acknowledge that I've waited at least 20 minutes GOR AN ICED COFFEE. I was so upset I just patiently waited because I had to goto work.so as I sum up my review I will never go back to this McDonald's which sucks because it's the nicest one we have here in Natomas .

Been going around to different locations to collect the despicable me 3 toys because who isn't a kid at heart. Fortunately, this place had one that I haven't collected yet but they only open it one box at a time, which means you are going to get the same toy until they run out of it... that sucks! Other places have at least two or maybe even three but this place only has one.  Another thing about this place is that their app coupons don't work. When scanned, it just says no connection. Doesn't work when they type in the code too. I even double checked the requirements of the coupon to make sure it was fulfilled and the worker checked as well but no luck....  Just go to in and out instead, save yourself the trouble.
This is the worsted McDonald's I've every been to. Cheeseburger was cold and the cheese was even melted!

where do i start with mC deez .... if ur N a hurry , i suggest  that U go N the restaurant ... the drive -thr getz real buzy..... seatz & the floor R keep pretty clean ... now i'm N there @  the lunch rush hour ..... so don't quote me , if you come in there and it'z  not kept up ..... but U didnt hear that from me ..lol linez R short ... pretty quick on there service ... alwayz room 2 sit ...  O ya no loitering & what really bitez No skateboardin , but i understand , So i leave U with A famous poet wordz .... 2x =kick push coast away i roll just a reble 2 the world with no place 2 go ... so i kick push coast

They are super slow here.  Today there was no line but thats because they were making every car pull over out front.  There were at least 4 or 5 cars out there waiting for our food.  Then the workers don't know who's food belongs to which car, so they are going from car to car trying to deliver it, meanwhile your fries and all your food is getting cold.  Then they forgot my drink so I had to wait some more.  They look unprofessional and unorganized!   What the hell is the point of a drive thru if you have to pull over and wait an extra 5-6 minutes??????  They do this all the time now! And this location is always out of something.  Just annoying!!! Get it together!!!!!  I hope management somewhere reads this!!

Old MacDonald had a farm E-I-E-I-O~ Nursery Rhyme. Thanks to all day breakfast, I have been frequenting to McD's a lot. What I like particularly about this franchise location is that their customer service (drive-thru) is awesome. The staff is well trained and you are in and out in few minutes.  I always get an EggMcMuffin without any meat for which they only charge me an dollar and another dollar for a large coffee (addicted to McD's coffee). At any other location they bill $3 something for the EggMcMuffin alone.   Few months ago, as I was grabbing my EggMcMuffin from the drive-thru window, one of the associate saw that I had some trash in my hand. She offered to take it from me. Not a big deal, but from a customer service viewpoint this meant a lot to me. I was very touched and moved by that young gals gesture. Later that day I called the store and thanked the Store manger for hiring such a superstar. We all go out and eat at restaurants, irrespective of wether they are upscale or fast food, what sets them apart and makes them memorable is our experience and a great customer experience lingers longer in your mind that the taste of French fries.

This location constantly runs out of items, they substitute things on your order to the low inventory of things without even asking the customer if thats okay with them. The other day I ordered through their drive-thru and had 2 items completely missing that i didnt recognize until arriving all the way back home. This lack of awareness and customer service is completely unacceptable.

Aside from the typical, "Our ice cream machine is down." This McDonald's franchise is awesome. The service is pretty good for McDonald's and they are fast. I'm not going to talk about the food bc it's McDonald's after all so that's why I'll give it 3 stars.

Well they blew it again. Asked for 2 large unsweetened iced teas with extra ice. Received  2 sweetened teas with little ice. The receipt says unsweetened iced teas with extra ice so I know the order was placed correctly.  It's  95 degrees outside. Waste of time and money.

I have tried to give this McDonald's the benefit of the doubt, probably 3xs or more. Every single time I have been disappointed. Cold food, waiting time is over 15 to 20 minutes, in the drive thru & not sure why, & oh and dry cheeseburgers. I always get told to pull to the side and wait when it's a normal order. And when my food is brought to me it's pushed on me like I was a burden. If you're going to offer hash browns in the afternoon, be prepared. Do not act like I'm the one messing up your schedule when it is a service you have granted! I'd rather drive to another McDonalds that is further for better food and better service!
Service is so slow and store full of flies so frustrated it's the only branch nearest us and I have no choice

The service is slow and lacks common sense I am tired of having to explain to people how to do their. It's really lack of common sense if you're handing a customer several drinks or even say a drink in a Sunday here's a hint Sunshine they may need a drink carrier that doesn't fall apart. When your drive-thru is so slow that people have to park and come in to witness This Disaster is ridiculous.   It's only fast food why do you have to make it so difficult a restaurant full of people yet you can't manage to get anyone their food while it's still warm

Best drive through McDonald's location I've been too because they have the cool 2 lanes so it would be more Efficient!!!! I always go through drive through because they are fast and I don't want to eat inside.   The employees who work drive through are nice, friendly and efficient!  I went here on a Saturday morning to get breakfast and the line was so long but the line moved very very fast and I was in and out within 10 minutes!   Will be coming back for breakfast soon!!

Best McDonald's I've been to. They always have hot and fresh French fries, everything else I order never goes wrong, and the staff are really friendly. I see a lot of people always coming here to this location than others. I'm sure if they had time to rate this McDonald's  it have at least 4.5 stars. Sucks that only the people that complains rate this place. Keep up the good work Staff!

Since this place became under new management and new staff, my visits here are not that great. Staff is slow and some are incompetent. This place used to be my favorite place because of the crew, but now, it is really depressing to come here.

I stopped in there today to get a $30 gift card and they told me I could not give them a credit card so I gave them cash $40 in cash. And also ordered a small Diet Coke and a fish fillet. I knew I should have gotten money back even my receipt said I should have gotten money back. But the lady kept on arguing with me so I went down and sat down came back showed her my receipt and then she basically threw $5 at me and said that the other taken out of my gift card which then brought my gift card them to $25 and then she threw $5 out me. I was still out $10 no matter how you do the math. There wasn't a couple next to me that was complaining that they bought two hamburgers but we're only given one and the lady insisted that's all they paid for

They always forget stuff. Today I got coffee it was okay.. they should really take a few extra seconds to wipe the side of the sticky cups before handing it out. The outside of my cup was covered in caramel and milk. Should of offered me napkins? Luckily I had one in the car.

This McDoanlds is tooooo slow! It has a drive through so long that I end up leaving and going somewhere else to get food. The frappe machine is down a lot. I would avoid this McDonalds until they get it together. I use to go here and get my food promptly. Not anymore... Takes forever now.

I would like to thank Jenny and her crew for doing such a great job with a large order that I had; feeding 90 people.  I am from out of town and had to find a McDonald's location close to where I was to deliver the food.  I placed the order over the phone and provided the time I was to pick it up.  When I arrived, everything was hot and ready to go. They helped me load my car and I was off. The food was great and everyone enjoyed it and thought it was so much fun to have a McDonald's holiday celebration.  Thanks again Jenny for making this such a positive and painless experience.

Total sweatshop environment. I went in to request gift cards and the employees were being exploited to the extreme that the cashier couldn't even communicate with the manager. She had to ask 3 times about gift cards then she rushed and got them, just to find out... they only accept cash. What kind of business doesn't accept cards? I felt bad that in the 21st century there's people working under those conditions
Service is good. McD is connected to the chevron mini mart. Very busy but everyone behind the counter works really fast and pays attention to ensure line moves quickly.
I came here to take a shit, but got some nuggets and some fries and some mozzy sticks. Pretty good. I'm shitting right now. So 4/5 in my book.

Good grief....WHY does it always take FOREVER to get through the drive-thru at this McD's? No matter what day I go, no matter what time, it is glacier-paced at best. Egads...but I gots to have my extra large Diet Coke for only $1. I can't bring myself to go through any other fast-food drive thru and pay more than $1.08, knowing Mickey D's has it for such a paltry sum.   Still...why the heck is this place sooooo sloooooow? The sacrifices one must make to save a buck ;)

Library? Ok. Bank teller window? Sure. Class room? Of course. But McDonalds drive thru... Give me a f'ing break!!  Delivering good customer service shouldn't be dependent on customer conformity. Not everyone has manners, but don't insult those of us who do by posting trivial demands on your patrons. If you can't collect money while a customer is on the phone, get a new job. I'm sorry I find huge ugly inappropriate signage very unappetizing. Everyone I know is aware that it's poor etiquette to talk on the phone while placing an order. Perhaps addressing the few who do not personally would make more of an impact. Oh, and despite giving the cashier my full attention she tried charging me for another cars order and ultimately I received raspberry sweet tea when I ordered original. Thumbs down

Not a big fan of Mc Donalds, it may surprise you that I checked in here.  However, I am one cheap B%*^@!d, and my thirst gets the best of me sometimes.   That is where Mc Donalds gets me, every time.  While it is not so in all parts of the country, in many parts of California Mc D draws me in by offering any sized drink for only a $1.  You can't beat that.  So I humbly go through the drive thru, order my diet coke with slice of lemon, and slip away quietly.

Worse Mc Donald's EVER, service in the drive through is ALWAYS slow except on a lucky occasion. Had the rudest cashier after a LONG wait in the drive thru I thought i gave him exact change i need to add a dollar so i did and when i went to hand it to him he snatched it and had an attitude.   Then to get home to have less than luke warm food. Id rather go to Northgate.

Okay so every mc Donald's is the same salty bad for you but tastes oh sooo good stuff.  I've been through this drive through before but last  night was a little different.  I don't know why but I came around 945 and the drive through workers were the nicest people ! Seriously I felt like I was in the twilight zone.  Occasionally you do get the creepy side who wants to hit on you in yhrbdrive through but this mix Donald's seriously blew me and my friends way.  The lady who gave us our food was wearing nice shirt so I guess she was the manager that day honestly hands down best experience!  I don't think I could ever be the chipper making minimum wadge!  Bravo
Always fast. Always friendly.

The freshest location in Sacramento, guaranteed to have freshly made food, by far the NICEST staff I've ever encountered, and consistent with their coffee. The inside is the same as any other McD's - slightly sticky and filmy. Attached to a Chevron quick mart.
Very friendly cashiers. Food is always great. My lil one loves going there. Bummer there isnt a play area but not big deal. Theres plenty of parks around. I do like how its adjoined with a chevron

After pumping gas at the Chevron that is attached to the hip to this McDonald's, I had a craving for french fries and the usual vanilla cone.  I found it funny that once you finish the car wash you are exited directly into the route of the drive thru.  $1.29 for a small french fry and $.99 for a vanilla cone.  Fries were warm but lacked salt.  My cone was almost gone by the time I reached the stoplight.  Cheery staff at the window so I can't complain.

Brought 3 tired kids to my local McDonald's for Mc Flurry treats after sports practice. Instructed them to toss a single piece of cardboard into their dumpster near the drive through. Apparently the manager had nothing better to do than smoke his cigarette, be the trash can police and send us right to Baskin robbins

This is your nightmare McDonald's.  They use plastic tables and chairs.  Imagine six cafeteria-like tables where each is surrounded 6 fold-up, plastic chairs.  And they're dirty!!  Be prepared to share table with strangers and weirdos if you come here.

A McDonalds that's part of a gas station.  That already spells trouble.  This is on the of the slowest McDonalds I've been too.  The workers here aren't the friendliest, nor brightest.  Convenience?  If you don't mind paying for overpriced gas.  When I go to McDonalds, I expect to order up the dollar menu and get my food within 5 minutes or less... not here.  I only come back because this is the closest Mickey Dees nearby where I live.    Gotta have my McChickens and Parfait!
Consistenly get my orders wrong. The workers aren't friendly.

I've come here for about 3 times, because I used to work for a campaign office in Natomas... and I have waited in the drive thru for minutes and minutes!!!! probably between 5-10 minutes which is very unacceptable... especially 3 times I've come through the drive-thru. The last time I was there (May '10) I honked my horn for about 10 seconds, things started going 'faster', but not really. :)

I hate this location. They always get orders wrong, you might as well go in instead of using the drive thru because u end up going in to fix your order. We got home after getting breakfast and our hashbrowns were cold, like still frozen in the middle. We called to tell them and said they were sorry and they had a new person in that area. Really? They didn't know they needed to cook the food?

Went through the drive thru, while siting waiting for my order I looked in to the window and saw a male employee preparing to restock the small refrigerator where they store the bottled water. He bent down towards the floor, touched the floor with BOTH HANDS, sat down and preceeded to restock the frig with his dirty hands. Beware ! and clean your bottles of water. The manager there needs to teach their staff on cleaniless and cross contaimnation.
Fries a bit dark - over-cooked or recooked, not up to par for McDonalds.

Poor service. It's next to a gas station near the freeway, and they must not get a lot of repeat customers. Always seem to forget something, bad fries or something else wrong. After several bad experiences, I've started to go to another location (inside nearby Walmart, 80 fwy East Natomas exit or 5 fwy South Richards exit)

I debated on one or two stars and the only reason they didn't get a 1 is that in a pinch, or true emergency I'd come back.  Typical McDonald's food, the line moved, they got me my stuff.  The inside was dirty, it's not in a great neighborhood, and don't get me started on the bathrooms.

Wanted to wash my hands prior to touching my food, was told to show a receipt before they would unlock the bathroom. Overheard, workers saying they don't know how to switch caramel sauce, offered customers chocolate instead. Left out or principle. You have rude employees who can't gauge their customers, who's there to buy food and who's there to loiter. Took my business elsewhere...also they should train employees on how to change things so customers actually get what they want.

Zeroooooo stars this location is dirtyyyyyyy beyond filthy Don't eat here I was so disgusted at how dirty it was I almost threw up.no napkins or toilet paper in restrooms. Homelesss people everywhere,it smelled bad,bad service. The health department should be called on this place fast before people get really sick!! I can't believe this location is still open!!

My family and I went here for a quick lunch yesterday. I'm not from this city, but this is the worst McDonald's I've been to. 1) They don't provide you with ice in the soda machine unless you ask them to turn on the ice section, 2) there are flies constantly flying around everywhere inside the restaurant which makes it feel very dirty, 3) the line moved very slowly compared to all the other McDonald's I've been to, and 4) the restroom was dirty and didn't provide any soap to wash your hands and that could be a health hazard. We didn't even want to dine inside because of how dirty it was and even thought about taking it to the car to eat. The only positive things about this location is it has a parking lot, drive through, and the McNuggets I ordered were good.

This is by far THE slowest location in Stockton!!! The actually hold up the line, and it constantly back up. The crew's attitudes about the situation is lousy!!! If it were not for the fact that this is the only fast food place near the Amtrak station, I would go somewhere else!!!!
omg these fuckin douchbags can not get a simple order correct. how do you fuck up a quarter pound deluxe?

The place is not clean.  The bathroom had no toilet tissue and no soap, so how do the workers wash their hands?  This is not sanitary. One star is generous.  Why hasn't the health department shut this place down?

I ordered two egg mcmufinns and they told me to pull over and wait in stall number one.  I waited for 10 minutes.  No one showed up.  After that I decided to follow up I went inside the dining room was dirty after the manager looked into my order she found they neglected to even start cooking it she didn't apologize and got snappy with me I asked for a refund.  They have no respect and professionalism there.  I am disgusted.  Don't go there helpers.  Lost of homeless people will bother you they are chronically understaffed and not friendly there.  Worst dining experience ever.

If you want cold fries, wilted lettuce, and a cold old tasting Big Mac, this is the place for you, oh, and don't forget about the panhandlers that expect to be paid because you are using "their" drive thru.

NO STARS!! This place is absolutely depressing. They never, ever get my order right. And you might as well come fully armed because it is scary!! I only come here because it is off of Crosstown Freeway but Im not doing that anymore. Its not worth it. How can one place always mess up your order?

The 1 star is for the underpaid drive through customer service. Panhandler alert be safe be careful and be alert . I'm tired of the old tea it tastes old it is old and a excuse like someone has not changed the liner is as old as the tea . Really if they cant keep the tea container clean what else is going on you cant see. We are now at 5 old teas in a row it used to be 2 out of 10 but I'm finished I not eating there if they cant keep a simple tea container clean I'm usually on a mission so I don't have tome to go back and wait in line again or go inside been there done that as well hence the old liner excuse which is as old as the liner must be. And yes you can tell when unsweetened tea is old just like old coffee. What happened to the dollar menu my dogs are sad no more chicken sandwich ,

this is a homeless shelter, it is filthy. I will never spend another dime in this sh**hole. they are too busy refilling the homeless peoples coffee and buzzing them in the restroom to serve anyone else. you will be panhandled inside and outside the store. I waited 15 minutes for my food before asking for a refund. no apology that they wasted my time. I called the "complaint line" at the phone number provided to me by the manager only to reach an answering machine so obviously they could care less. the sign outside the door should be good enough reason to not go here. it is shown in the picture stating "no shopping cart or sleeping bags or that it is not a hang out, yet they allow all of it. this place gives mc donalds a bad image and the franchisee should be held accountable. WHAT A DUMP.

I had the worst experience here.. The drive thru lady charged my bill to the car in front of me. She took forever ringing me up a second time. Then another woman came to help, and when I paid the cashier shorted me ten dollars..I asked for a refund and left foodless.15 minutes waisted.. Beware if you come here in a hurry. Count your cash..

Do I have to give  it a whole star? I first went to the restroom. That was all I had to see and didn't choose to order anything. I saw zero TP, one fly, one maggot crawling around, and zero hand soap dispensers ( much less soap to wash up). Wow, how are you expected to eat with clean hands.

This place is connected to a gas station and is next to the freeway so it's a very busy McDonald's.  To add to it, it is the closest one to all the offices downtown.  Beware there are a lot of weirdos hanging around this area and are very pushy about asking for money.  Needless to say, lock your doors and try not to come here at night.

I simply love this place! McDonalds is my favorite fast food restaurant. The smell of walking in as if I were in heaven eating endless hot fresh fries. Priceless. I feel greeted with such comfort every time I come in. It never fails to feel satisfy and pleased with customer service. When I hear my order being called I hear excitement of other customers eating, talking about how their day was. What plans they have for the weekend.  I hear joy as is life has stopped for that moment of their life's to eat a delicious meal. I could see how happy a meal can please an individual. When I picked up my order the first thing I did was touched the brown paper bag. Also, doubled check if my order was complete. I knew it was worth waiting for a few minutes to get my meal.

Got a kids meal today about 5pm. The small soda was full of ice.   What I mean is that they filled the cup to the top with ice, then put the soda in.   My son was crying the whole way home, that there wasn't enough soda in the cup.  Just how cheap is this place?  Never had that happen before.

I leave for work at 4am and one morning I decided to drive threw for breakfast thinking this place would be fast. I was very wrong. I am not embellishing I was sitting at the drive window for at least half an hour for a basic breakfast meal (two pancakes, two sausage, two eggs). I was so pissed off and worried I'd be late for work that I swore I would never return to this place.

I'm not big on reviewing corporate fast food joints but I have had very poor experiences at this one. The management is horrible. I can easily tell that the staff is poorly trained and not from the surrounding community. One day I stood by the counter to request condiments, and  found myself standing there for days with know service. Unfortunately this McDonald's is also responsible for the gentrification of the historic Little Manila site. I asked employees about the banners hung around the block of Man@gs and they were clueless. It's bad enough that history was replaced with food that can kill you and it's even  more problematic that these employees do not know the community they are working in.

I wanted to try what looked like a newer place a few blocks over, The Brick something Pizza but the kids saw the Micky D's and you know the rest of the story.  Confortable seating with more space between tables than most locations.  Food better than most.  Of course in a comparison of several McDonald's I'd say the difference in quality is very slim. This one didn't have the old never changed cooking oil taste in the fries so I'll give it the 4 stars.  But fast food restaurants are the apples and all other restaurants are oranges so don't confuse the ratings.     There's lots of parking too.  We chose the diagonal parking.

I hate to give McDonald's more than 2 stars, but I grew up here! The food deserves about 1 star. My parents live literally one block away. I used to go here on "field trips" with my 3rd grade class! They had Fry Guy high chairs! Hamburgular wallpaper, Grimace paintings, Mayor McCheese sculptures! I used to be super-stoked about getting a happy meal, back when they had totally awesome toys!! legos, penny racers?!     Now, it's just another McDonald's, no more fun stuff....what more do I have to say? Oh yeah, "HOOK IT UP WITH A FILLET-O-FISH!!!!"   **Update** What was I thinking giving a McDonald's 3 stars! I was probably drunk.

I don't care what anyone says, McDonalds is good! Yeah yeah it's bad for you. So what. So are a lot of other things. You only live once right? enjoy it.  This McyD's is better than the others in stockton. I don't know how, and i don't know why, it just is. Maybe because it's right off the freeway and is busy? I'm not sure. But i do know that it is connected to a gas station so you can buy your food and get a mountain dew or pepsi instead of stupid coke! isn't that nice mr pepsi lover??

This was a big surprise. We got a chicken wrap by mistake in Washington and it was delicious. We then orderd one in Stockton and it was delicious. I also had the Angus wrap. Really good. Who would have thought that McDonalds would produce such food. We also love the angus burgers.

Came through the Drive Thru (West Cap & Westacre) on 08/21 for B-fast and ordered a No. 2 w/ Decaf coffee.  Get to my office and what do I have?  NO Hash Brown and a Caffeinated Coffee!  GREAT!  Ya know something, robots can distinguish the difference between Decaf and Caffeinated AND they don't forget the Hash Brown.  Came through here once for lunch a year or so ago and I had the same issue.  I think I'll just avoid this location all together.  There's another one just up the road on West Cap & Harbor.

Girl behind the counter didn't want to work the register. Gave attitude when she was told to hop on and take orders. It looked like a bunch of high schoolers were operating the place.  Update: Just took a bite into my McDouble. The bun was hard and the patty was dry. How do you mess up a McDouble?

The worst! Watch if you order a kids meal they automatically up charge for a larger drink and don't say anything. Then play dumb when you ask them about it. Also I ordered I happy meal and a regular meal. I got 3 packets of ketchup and no napkins. They can't multi task in the drive through and it's so slow! Food is cold too.

I really can't imagine why the people running this location haven't been fired. Look, I've worked service industry jobs and I understand how hectic and confusing it can get, but I also don't have a lot of money so it is infuriating when nearly every single time I end up having to turn around because my (relatively straightforward) order was completely wrong. Their drive thru policy seems to be "tell us your order and we will try to remember it by the time you get to the window" rather than actually entering in the order as you give it to them so you can see it on the screen and ensure it is correct. If you order inside, it usually takes 20+ minutes because of the constant confusion of people's orders being wrong. It's a McDonald's. I get it. But my standards aren't that high, and having to constantly drive back to get my order fixed should not be the default.
Out of all McDonald's in West Sacramento this is by far the WORST. management is a joke.

The place wasn't clean, the service WAS SLOW, and you couldn't find the napkins and the straw got jammed. We waited for 35 minutes until we got our 2 happy meals and our 2 drinks, even the man in line said this is taking forever. Only 3 customers at that time.

The manager needs to bring in more employees for the am rush. It seems business is catered to the drive up customer. Today at the counter I waited 10 minutes for my one item, cup of coffee. A young black man was waiting for a cup of water when I walked in. Having heard him politely saying twice, "still waiting for my water" he was ignored. After waiting ten minutes for my coffee I asked for a cup of water and waited another minute to receive it. On the way out I gave it to the young man and politely he thanked me. I know for a fact he was being ignored and I personally think because he is black service was not given in a timely manner. Be careful McDonald's I see a lawsuit in the making.  One last note: coffee tasted watered down today.

Don't get me started on this place. I was literally stuck in the drive-through for 45 minutes one time because they took so long. Other times you're still waiting FOREVER. It's dirty, the employees couldn't care less about their job, and the manager couldn't either. The food is always old and stale, never fresh. It's the worst McDonald's I've ever been to and I've been here many times since it's down the street. After giving them like 20 tries, we just drive out of our way to the other one down West Capitol.
Would not honor their coupon that just arrived by mail~ went to Subway instead
This location is so slow. In the time it took to get a Big Mac and Fries I could have sat down in a Chili's and been served a beer and a dinner.

Horrible, nasty experience there today with our two toddler grandchildren.  There was a young black man in there with no shirt on and pants sagging with his butt cheeks hanging out in the back.  He got up several times to move around and kept grabbing his crotch to keep his pants up.  He was on the phone with no food.  He was later met by two other young black men with their butts hanging out of their sagging pants and they all loitered outside the door sassing people as they walked out.  Two policemen showed up in separate cars while we were there because  two black guys coming through the drive thru  had caused enough  trouble  to have the cops called on them.  A disheveled white man with mismatched dirty clothing came in to use the bathroom, didn't buy any food.  As we were getting in our car to leave, another white man who looked like he'd been sleeping in his clothes begged for money and then started scaveging through the dumpster.  NEVER again. One star because the food was good and the kids behind the counter were trying to do their jobs.  They deserve better management. Somebody seems to want to lose his franchise.

Nothing but a bunch of young individuals who don't know what they're doing. First I'm in the Drive-Thru line for about 15 minutes and there was only 3 cars in front of me. Then to boot once I get my order, my sandwich isn't even in my bag! So I go in and let them know and once I get my sandwich it has onions and pickles, something I requested to be off and it even shows it on my receipt. Like really? How hard is it to make it a sandwich? You had ONE JOB
Slowest McDonald's ever  ,especially in the drive thru!! And per usual their ice cream machine is always broken 24/7

Classic minimum wage employees: they never get orders correct. Shame on me for coming back and giving these guys several chances.  I'd recommend going to the McDonald's off Harbor, which is infinitely better than this one.

Just ordered four Buttermilk Chicken Sandwiches. Two of them were made with old, hard, dried-out chicken. Totally ruined my experience. I almost drove back, but they were buy-one-get-one-free on McD's mobile app. Anyway, this is a perfect example of why I'm usually reluctant to buy the more expensive sandwiches on their menu.

Worst customer service ever! I will never ever return to this junk place, even if this was the last McD on earth. After trying to ask for lids and straw that they do not have stocked up front, the white guy have the guts to say "what do you need?" Of course I need lids and straws!!!!! And besides that, they weren't even busy at all!
Reading the reviews, maybe I came at a good time. Location was clean. Cashier was very polite. Got the order correct and quickly. Good experience for McDs.

This is the worst McDonald's I have ever been to, and I live nearby so I have the misfortune of visiting it often. They are so confused by the app. Dear God, do not try to use the app here or you'll stall their whole operation. My latest endeavor was to order 2 milkshakes on the app. Their machine was down (big surprise) but they put my order through anyway, so the money came out of my account. They said I had to call the app to get my money back. They sent me coupons for free shakes. Cool. I walk down to this McDonald's (huge mistake, why do I keep going here?). They don't take paper coupons. Even after I explained that I have them because I paid for shakes and never got them. Nope, still don't take them. I call customer service. They'll forward my compliant. Great. I still don't have milkshakes that I've paid for. Please don't go to this store. I wish I could rate them less than 1 star.

All I can say is RUDE A** EMPLOYEE. No hello and no thank you. All I got was " what can I get for you." Only one car was in front of me. Took my order all wrong. Asked them to repeat my order at the first window. Still got it wrong. Went to the second window. Gave me the wrong food. I corrected them and showed them my receipt. No sorry no nothing. Gave me a bag that was too small for my food. Mind that I only order the burrito meal and 2 sausage egg and cheese. Didn't give back my receipt. Just horrible service. Whoever was working drive they in both window @10 am needs to learn manners.

I've lived in West Sacramento for over 20 years and this McDonald's seems to only get worse. The used to have an outside Playland but it stunk so bad like piss that they took it out so now there's no Playland the closest Playland is Natomas. I always ordercthe same thing "double cheese with pickles only extra pickles please" And they always mess it up!!

***THIS PLACE IS FLAT OUT HORRIBLE!***  Today, 7/5/16 I went there at 10:30am with my 60 Year old Mom, my 10 year old daughter and 6 year old daughter.  My Mom and 6 year old daughter had to go to the restroom really bad. While I was in a long line waiting to order, my Mom asks the lady at the register if they can open the women's restroom door.  The lady tells my Mom you have to make a purchase before they open the restroom.  I ask the lady, hi I'm in line to pace an order, could you please open the restroom for my Mom and daughter?  She's says NO not until you make your purchase.  I was appalled.  Of course we decide to take our business else where.  My Mom takes my daughter across the street to a Supermarket to use the restroom.  I ask for a Manager.  The Manager tells me the same thing.  You have to make a purchase before we push the button under the counter to open the restroom.  What a joke.  Then the Manager refuses to give me her name.  By far the WORST customer experience I've ever had.
Waited in drivethru only to find out they were only accepting cash. My expectations could not have been lower and they still were not met.

Pros: - There are three cashiers here who are absolutely fenomenal, probably the best of any fast food cashiers in West Sac. I'll add their names if I ever ask them.   - The food tastes as good as any other McDonalds, although they often get my order wrong.   Cons:  - They have a hard time controlling the tweakers. They are usually around the parking lot asking for extra change.    - Because so many tweakers enter the restaurant, the soda machines are usually off, which is a small inconvenience for those of us who actually pay for a drink. The bathrooms are always locked as well.   - They very often give me a Sausage McMuffin instead of an Egg McMuffin. That is a problem at every McDonalds, but here they seem to make that mistake very often.  - The guy who does the maintenance (cleaning) in the morning hours is a starer. He's always staring. Very creepy.   Having said that, I still prefer this McDoanlds over the other 3 in West Sac, mostly because of the cashiers.
Consistantly horrible, credit card machines go down alot, which seems extremely shady for a well known business. Food normally cold or wrong.
